story:
(Scroll down for English)

Somos una banda de Metal de Quito, Ecuador. Nacimos a finales del 2003 y hasta el día de hoy hemos lanzado tres discos, algunos videos y hemos tocado en los más grandes festivales del Ecuador, habiendo recorrido gran parte del país. 

En Abril de este año, vamos a unir fuerzas con una banda de Finlandia, Khroma, con quienes vamos a realizar una gira de 22 fechas en 25 días, recorriendo más de 10000 kilómetros de carretera para visitar 22 ciudades de Bélgica, Suiza, España, Francia, Italia, Holanda, Alemania, Dinamarca, Polonia y República Checa. 

Como parte de este proyecto, viajará con nosotros el director Carlos Andrés Terán, de la productora Vertigo, con quien vamos a hacer un documental acerca de nuestras experiencias en Europa, y el encuentro entre bandas de Metal provenientes de partes muy distintas del mundo.


Somos una agrupación independiente que siempre ha funcionado en base a la autogestión. Hemos trabajado muy duro y hemos visto la recompensa en contar con un público propio, del cual estamos muy agradecidos.


En el 2015 lanzamos Portales, considerado un disco "vital", "inmenso" y uno de los 5 mejores discos ecuatorianos del año según Plan Arteria. Portales es la conclusión de varios años de trabajo y está "hecho para reventar las cabezas del público metalero más exigente, a través de una combinación de elementos experimentales y agresividad" (Radio Cocoa). 


Creemos en nuestro trabajo y queremos que lo escuchen fuera del Ecuador. Tenemos muchos planes para este año, pero necesitamos de tu apoyo para poderlos cumplir. Alcanzar el objetivo de esta campaña nos permitirá lograr un objetivo que tenemos desde hace mucho tiempo y cumplir con un sueño, que es recorrer otras partes del mundo tocando nuestra música. También nos permitirá crear más videos, otros documentales, y publicar nuestra música en nuevos formatos, todo lo cual podremos compartir con todos ustedes.

Lo que necesitamos

Para cualquier banda es un reto llegar a tocar fuera de su país, y para nosotros han habido muchos obstáculos por sortear para llegar a este punto.

Necesitamos un mínimo de $3000 que nos permitirán cubrir necesidades de la gira como un transporte propio, alquilar equipos, y preparar la mercadería y discos que necesitamos para la gira y para las recompensas de esta campaña, así como ayudarnos a cubrir nuestros gastos.

Si logramos recaudar más de $5000 vamos a publicar un libro de tablaturas oficiales de todas las canciones de Colapso, que vendrá acompañado de un DVD con el documental de la gira, y se lo entregará como recompensa adicional a los contribuyentes de más de $45.

Si no puedes contribuir mediante esta plataforma, puedes contribuir mediante depósito bancario directo a la siguiente cuenta:

Cuenta de ahorros PRODUBANCO
No. 12007058689
Andrés Benavides CI 1711692564

Lo que obtienes

Por $5:

Tu nombre en los agradecimientos especiales del documental de la gira

Recibirás una descarga digital de:

  • un poster exclusivo
  • todas las letras y la historia de Colapso

Por $30:

Tu nombre en los agradecimientos especiales del documental de la gira

Recibirás una descarga digital de:

  • Portales (2015)
  • Destino Infierno (2011)
  • Después del Dolor (2007)
  • Libro de tablaturas oficial de Colapso
  • Un poster exclusivo
  • Todas las letras y la historia de Colapso

Por $45:

Edición limitada de la Camiseta Oficial del Tour

Tu nombre en los agradecimientos especiales del documental de la gira

Recibirás una descarga digital de:

  • Portales (2015)
  • Destino Infierno (2011)
  • Después del Dolor (2007)
  • Libro de tablaturas oficial de Colapso
  • Un poster exclusivo
  • Todas las letras y la historia de Colapso

Por $60:

2 Entradas al concierto que haremos al volver de Europa

Portales (2015) en formato CD

Credito de Co-productor en el documental de la gira

Poster autografiado y Stickers

Tu nombre en los agradecimientos especiales del documental de la gira

Recibirás una descarga digital de:

  • Portales (2015)
  • Destino Infierno (2011)
  • Después del Dolor (2007)
  • Libro de tablaturas oficial de Colapso
  • Un poster exclusivo
  • Todas las letras y la historia de Colapso

Por $120:

Puedes escoger entre:

Un arte original de Diego Rojas (diseño gráfico, ilustración)

o

5 horas de clases con Andrés Benavides (Batería), Mauro Pazmiño (Guitarra), o Andrés Égüez (Bajo), solo disponible en Quito

Credito de Co-productor en el documental de la gira

Poster autografiado y Stickers

Tu nombre en los agradecimientos especiales del documental de la gira

Recibirás una descarga digital de:

  • Portales (2015)
  • Destino Infierno (2011)
  • Después del Dolor (2007)
  • Libro de tablaturas oficial de Colapso
  • Un poster exclusivo
  • Todas las letras y la historia de Colapso

Por $200:

Invitación a concierto privado, asado y fiesta en una propiedad fuera de Quito
(No incluye gastos de transporte)

Camiseta oficial de la gira

Buzo oficial de la gira

Portales (2015) en formato CD

Credito de Co-productor en el documental de la gira

Poster autografiado y Stickers

Tu nombre en los agradecimientos especiales del documental de la gira

Recibirás una descarga digital de:

  • Portales (2015)
  • Destino Infierno (2011)
  • Después del Dolor (2007)
  • Libro de tablaturas oficial de Colapso
  • Un poster exclusivo
  • Todas las letras y la historia de Colapso

Nuestro compromiso

Para nosotros cumplir esta gira será la conclusión de un largo camino, y el principio del resto de nuestra existencia como Colapso. Creemos en la fuerza y calidad de nuestro material discográfico, y creemos en llegar con nuestra música a otros lugares del mundo. La presencia de bandas independientes ecuatorianas en Europa le abre las puertas al intercambio musical entre Ecuador y Europa, lo cual beneficia a nuestra escena local.

La calidad de nuestro trabajo durante los últimos 12 años es la garantía de que al apoyarnos, respaldas una iniciativa que va a rendir frutos.

Vamos a mantenerlos constantemente informados de nuestro recorrido, y de todo lo que vamos a conocer y hacer en Europa. Se parte de este viaje.

Tu ayuda difundiendo esta campaña es muy importante. Por favor coméntala y compártela por redes sociales.

English:

We're a Metal band from Quito, Ecuador. We started around late 2003 and to date we have released three albums, a few videos, and we've played on the biggest stages in Ecuador, having played throughout most of the country.

Come April this year, we will join forces with Finnish band Khroma, with whom we'll do a 21-23 date tour of Europe over 24 days, traveling over 10000 km on the road to play in several cities of Belgium, Switzerland, Spain, France, Italy, Netherlands, Germany, Denmark, Poland and Czech Republic.

As part of this project, we'll travel with director Carlos Andrés Terán, of Vertigo productions, with whom we'll film a documentary about our experiences in Europe, and the meeting of bands from two very different parts of the world.

We're an independent band, and we've always had a DIY attitude. We've worked very hard and we've seen a reward in gaining a local audience of our own, for which we're very grateful.

In 2015 we released Portales, called a "vital" and "immense" album, and listed among the top 5 Ecuadorian albums of the year by Plan Arteria. Portales is the fruit of several years of work and it's "made to blow away the most demanding metalhead audience, through a combination of experimental elements and aggressiveness" (Radio Cocoa). 

We believe in the quality of our work, and we want our music to be heard outside of Ecuador. We have a lot of plans for this year, but we need your support to make them happen. Reaching the goal of this campaign would allow us to achieve a long held objective, and accomplish our dream of traveling to other parts of the world playing our music. It will also allow us to carry on creating more videos, new documentaries, and publishing our music in new formats, all of which we'll be able to share with you.

What we need

It's a challenge for any band to play outside of their home country, and there have been many obstacles for us before we could get to this point.

We need at least USD $3000 which will help us cover tour expenses such as transportation, gear rental, and making merch for sale and to reward your contributions, as well as cover other expenses.

If we can get over USD $5000 we'll publish an Official Tab Book with all of our songs, which will include a DVD of our Tour documentary and which will be added as a reward in every level over USD $45.

What you get

For USD $5: Our eternal gratefulness, plus your name will be included under Special Thanks in our documentary credits,  and a digital download of an exclusive poster, the lyrics and story of Colapso.

For USD $30: Your name will be included under Special Thanks in our documentary credits,  and a digital download of our entire discography (Portales, Destino Infierno, Después del Dolor), the official Colapso Tab Book, an exclusive poster, and the lyrics and story of Colapso.

For $45: You'll get a Limited Edition Official Tour T Shirt, your name will be included under Special Thanks in our documentary credits, a signed poster and stickers, and a digital download of our entire discography (Portales, Destino Infierno, Después del Dolor), the official Colapso Tab Book, an exclusive poster, and the lyrics and story of Colapso.

For $60: You'll get 2 Tickets to one of our shows on the tour, or to our homecoming show after we return to Quito, our album Portales in CD format, a Co-production credit in our tour documentary, a signed poster and stickers, and a digital download of our entire discography (Portales, Destino Infierno, Después del Dolor), the official Colapso Tab Book, an exclusive poster, and the lyrics and story of Colapso.

Por $120: You can choose between an original artwork by Diego Rojas (Design, Illustration), or 5 hours of drum, guitar, or bass lessons with the members of the band (Only available in Quito), and you'll get a Co-production credit in our tour documentary, a signed poster and stickers, and a digital download of our entire discography (Portales, Destino Infierno, Después del Dolor), the official Colapso Tab Book, an exclusive poster, and the lyrics and story of Colapso.

For $200: You'll get an invitation to a private concert and party outside of Quito (Doesn't include transportation), a Limited Edition Official Tour T Shirt and Hoodie, our album Portales in CD format, a Co-production credit in our tour documentary, a signed poster and stickers, and a digital download of our entire discography (Portales, Destino Infierno, Después del Dolor), the official Colapso Tab Book, an exclusive poster, and the lyrics and story of Colapso.

Our Commitment

For us, achieving this goal would mark the end of a long path, and the beginning of the rest of our existence as Colapso. We believe in the power and quality of our recorded material, and we believe in reaching other parts of the world with our music. The presence of independent bands from Ecuador in Europe helps establish the avenues for musical exchange between Ecuador and Europe for the benefit of our local scene.

The quality of our work of the last 12 years is our warranty that by supporting us, you're supporting an initiative that will accomplish its goals.

We'll keep you constantly informed of our activities, and of everything we're going to find and do in Europe. Join us in this journey.

Your help spreading the word about this campaign is very important. Please share it.

story:
I wrote and recorded most of Seven Shades two years ago.....

in the meantime I've toured, had the mixes done, ruminated, and I realized it was missing a key song that represents this era of songwriting.

Recording is a delicate and wonderful challenge. Sometimes you get lucky...the earth sighs, the sky cracks open and the universe echoes in approval. This project feels like one of those moments. I'm so thankful to have worked with good friends and colleagues, Tyler Quint (bass), Paul Braunstein (drums), James Robertson (guitar) and Neil Quinn (Juno keys) who have fully immersed themselves in this recording.

In my ruminations, I realized I wanted an immersive multi sensorial, live music experience rather than a traditional live performance. Seven Shades represents the murky space between the end and the beginning. Artist Joanne Filletti was also working on a visual representation of this and we serendipitously connected.

We are collaborating on the eve of October 3rd for her installation reception at Gerrard Art Space (Toronto) and my record release for a cathartic experience.

This is a pivotal moment and the last record I am making on my own.

I'm booked and ready to record this final song and still need to do the mastering, promo and make hard copies. I've always self-funded my records and this time with a little help from you, Seven Shades will be my 3rd and final personal album!


"There's a lot of heart in the charming music made by Rebecca Everett. It would be one thing just to record music that sounds like this, but Rebecca carries this sound everywhere she goes - she makes music that suits who she is deep down.
The classic-chic dresses, the hair all piled-up, a good selection of enchanting glasses, and the buckets of laughter she has for an increasingly dark and silly world - it's quite a package.
Her music is attention catching, and I want to know what's next. "
Mark Wigmore - Reporter/Producer CBC RADIO 2


What I Need

Yesterday I had a generous donation of $100 that inspired this campaign!

Here's what the $1500 is for:
  • $400 to record the last song
  • $600 for promo (on-line and print)
  • $200 for mastering (a generously discounted price from a friend)
  • $300 to make 100 cd's

“Rebecca Everett is a proven songwriter with a unique talent to sing and deliver a performance that captivates and penetrates the heart and soul of life”. Roman Klun - Innsbruck Records


    Other Ways You Can Help

    I know money can be tight, so if you can't contribute financially, you can still help!

      Please share this campaign with as many people as you can.

      • Post it
      • Talk about it
      • And use the indiegogo share tools at the bottom of the page.

    I appreciate any help I can get in spreading the word and reaching the goal.

    Thank you!

story:
Here's The Story...

David Wiseman has done a great deal for the musical community in Yancey County, NC. Now I am asking the community to support David's journey: to the Mary Gauthier Songwriting Workshop, June 18-20, in Nasheville TN. (If you have heard David sing at jams, or in a house concert, you probably know that he is an avid fan of Mary Gauthier).

We need to raise at least $995 in the next month to make this happen. But $995 is just the workshop fee. I hope we can raise more than that, so David will not have to sleep in his van (although he seems to relish that prospect!).

David is already registered for the workshop, thanks to an anonymous Credit Card (no one will ever know if it was Visa, MasterCard, or something else!) This Credit Card simply asked to be re-paid by a campaign like this.

Whether you can contribte $25, $50, or $100 (or more), David will personally give you a "high-five", and maybe even a kiss on the cheek. Or a kiss on the back of his hand on your cheek.

Even if we do not raise the entire amount, all money raised will still go toward this goal: Sending David Wiseman to the Mary Gauthier Sonwriting Workshop.

David's Impact on our Community...

Did you enjoy the sense of community and the weekly music that happened at Kirkwood's Cafe every Friday?

Do you enjoy the Micaville Jam, which has grown to the point where the OOAK Gallery is talking about expansion?

These are some of the ways David has contributed to this community.

Now let us give something back to David, and to his music.


Maybe he will even write a ballad where no one dies.

Other Ways to Help...

Even if you cannot contribute, please do whatever you can to get the word out to your friends. Pass this along by email. Share on Facebook or other social media.

(Don't have a credit card? A lot of people in our are don't. Contact me for alternatives).

story:
Short Summary

Back in 2017 Van Alen has started an instrumental project, which is coming to and end. The String Theory EP is recorded and ready to be set free in Septermber 2019.  

What We Need & What You Get

This EP is the first solo album and needs a matching financing and so the major goal is to keep the expenses low. The whole production costs consist of

  • Recording, Mixing and Mastering Costs
  • Video Production
  • Merch Production
  • Promotional Costs

The Impact

The funding goal is 500€ and it helps me a lot to break even. With your help this EP will be just a kick off for a further instrumental path.

Thank you!

Yours

Van Alen

story:
Short Summary

I am very excited about this collection of songs and I am determined to make this record happen despite the current world health situation. If you wish to support this album and my future music, that would be amazing and I will be forever grateful. I will forever remember you as being one of the people who helped bring this thing to life.

What We Need & What You Get

This funding will go towards studio time costs, mastering, album artwork, creating vinyl, and shooting high quality music videos.

You will be able to be one of the earliest listeners of the album before its release, plus you'll receive a limited edition complimentary Once Belonged sticker!

If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still go towards the same causes, but it just might take a couple months longer to complete the album. But this will not affect the outcome.

The Impact

I have been releasing my own original music since 2014 and have always had great results with these producers. My 2018 EP was recorded with the same producers and it has since received praising accolades from outlets such as 9 to 5 Mag, SC Music Guide, and CisternYard Radio.

 

I am an extremely self motivated person and I am determined to overcome any obstacles such as additional funds for touring that come later on. If it comes down to it, I will work some extra hours to get over any hurdles.

story:
What We Need

We will be recording this album during the second week of August, and this is how the money will be used:

  • Actual recording and mastering of album
  • CD duplication
  • Graphic work for album
  • Music licensing and fees
  • Travel expenses to recording studio in FL

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you aren't able to contribute at this time. Would you pray that God would use this album to be an encouragement to folks. Would you also pray that He would provide the needed funds quickly? 

Also, would you help us out by sharing this on your social media platforms? Tell others about this project and how they can give.

Thank you so much for your time and help as we endeavor to be a blessing and encouragement to you with good, godly music!

story:
THE ALBUM

I've had the great fortune of leading a career that has stepped into many different musical settings. However, almost all of my creative work has been on behalf of other artists—I have not yet had the chance to put out my own music with my own stamp and signature on it. With your help, I'm thrilled that I'll be able to change that! This fall, I'll be recording my debut jazz album under my own name. I have been writing jazz music for a large portion of my life, and am eager to finally commemorate some of it on a recording. Releasing my own project will not only help to change how I view myself as an artist, but will also be fundamental in helping me look at how I approach future creative collaborations. 

For those of you who don't yet know my work, I'll direct you to this video of a piece I wrote for jazz quartet and choir that was released on inauguration day of this year as a musical counterpoint to the current political rhetoric. All funds raised from this project were donated to the Brave New Films foundation. 

I'm very lucky to have a band of exceptionally gifted musicians. While I'm eternally grateful that they share their talents and friendship with me, I want to ensure that I pay them what they're worth. This is the chief motivation for initiating this campaign. The funds raised on Indiegogo will also cover the production costs, which are detailed below, but my central focus is on compensating my fellow musicians—just as I would like to be if the roles were reversed. Too often we undervalue the talents of musicians, and I don't want to in any way tarnish my music with that stigma. Crowdfunding is the modern form of patronage, a practice which has allowed artists to make art for most of human history. I need your help to allow all of my collaborators to do what they do best. While I can't promise a specific and monetary return on investment, a contribution to this campaign is direct patronage of musical talents at their finest.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The album will be recorded in Pittsburgh, PA at the beautiful Audible Images recording studio. Most of my core band resides in New York City, so I wanted to record somewhere on the East Coast, and I was offered a wonderful deal to record in Pittsburgh. This studio offers a gorgeous piano, a spacious room, and microphones that were used on classic jazz records in the 60s and 70s. I intend on recording the quintet all live in the same room, a practice that is rarely implemented in modern recording, to maintain the warmth and authenticity of sound that so many classic jazz records have. 

 

THE BAND

The core band is a quintet:

Daniel Weidlein—Saxophones

Christian Li—Piano

Mike Bono—Guitar

Raviv Markovitz—Bass

Roberto Giaquinto—Drums

I have played numerous shows in New York City with these four incredible musicians and am thrilled to have them be a part of this. Raviv and Mike were both part of the Jazz Mentor Fellowship with me at the Stanford Jazz Workshop, and Christian and Roberto are both graduates of Berkelee School of Music who each have a long list of impressive credits as touring musicians.

The band will also include numerous special guests. That instrumentation will include a string quartet, singers, and a clarinetist/flautist. 

 

THE BOTTOM LINE

Compensation for the musicians will make up about ⅔ of the budget. I will also be covering the quintet's travel costs from New York City (and myself from LA) to our rented studio in Pittsburgh, and their room and board while we're recording. Other costs include:

$1500—studio rental and engineering from Grammy Award-winning engineer Jay Dudt

$1000—Mastering, CD production, and distribution. I will be contributing my own funds for the remainder of these costs as they will exceed $1000.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

There are some wonderful perks that you can explore in exchange for donating to this campaign. From digital downloads of the music, to signed albums, producer credits, and some experiential perks, there's something for everybody! If you have any suggestions for perks that you would love to receive, please shoot me a message and we might be able to add it! 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Indiegogo allows me to collect funds, even if the full goal isn't met. However, if I can't raise a minimum of $5000, I won't be able to make up the remainder and will have to pull the plug on the project. If I have not reached $5000 3 days prior to the end of the campaign, I will cancel the Indiegogo campaign and you will be refunded your contribution. Please know that when you contribute to the project, your card is charged immediately upon checking out. This is different than Kickstarter and I don't want anybody to be blindsided by it.

THE STRETCH GOAL

I'm a really big fan of vinyl. Once before on a collaborative album that I crowdfunded, we tried to promise top donors vinyl copies of the record only to find out just how expensive pressing vinyl is these days. We had to let them down easy, and I was dismayed that I couldn't own my own music on vinyl. SO, my ultimate stretch goal is to raise an additional $2500 to press a very limited run of vinyl copies of the music. If we achieve this, the top 10 donors would automatically receive a vinyl copy, and hopefully some other top donors would as well. I will keep two copies—one to frame on the wall, and one to wear out with the needle.

 

CROWDFUNDING—MODERN PATRONAGE

Patronage has been a central tenet of the arts since the dawn of society. Art is not created in a bubble. It reacts to the world around it, and it is facilitated and supported by those with the means to do so. As with everything in the global, digital age, patronage has morphed into a collaborative effort we call crowdfunding. Through your donations, you each become patrons of my art and thus become inherent parts of the artistry itself. I want to bring you all inside the process with me and share myself, both through my music and through behind-the-scenes content.

The biggest challenge will be ensuring that I raise the full amount. If I cannot raise the $7500 I will be forced to face a painful decision of what I can sacrifice and still record my music. As it is, the musicians I'm hiring probably deserve 10x what I will be able to pay them after a successful campaign, but if I can't raise the full amount, then they probably won't be able to participate as they all have bottom lines they need to meet. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to a financial contribution, or if you're not in a place to contribute financially at all, a huge way to help this campaign is by spreading the word. Indiegogo offers some wonderful and intuitive share tools that you'll see right on this page. Please share this however is most natural and compelling for you—tell your friends and family on the phone, or in an email, or by carrier pigeon!

I can't thank you enough for taking the time to consider my endeavor, and I can't wait to share my music with you!

story:
LaVon Fisher-Wilson, star of the Broadway Stage, is now launching her first album!!!!

Hey All!

There is a dream of mine that I have kept in my back pocket my whole life and the time has come to make this dream a reality: Recording an album of my own!

This pandemic has been a tough one for all of us, and especially harsh for artists who were forced to stop performing and were ultimately homebound. But something special happened during the downtime: music was pouring out of me. Every day! Lyrics about my life, my experiences, my challenges and my triumphs presented themselves and what formulated was a wonderful celebration of the music of my soul!

And one of the songs was so great, it is being made into a musical! I’m beyond thrilled! 

So I’m here to ask for your help to finish this amazing album!  This project means the world to me. And to collaborate on this with my Vonettes, my sisters, would be just a dream come true! We’ve already finished two songs to rave reviews! Let’s finish this puppy! I am eternally grateful for your help! I know we are all just getting our footing after this epidemic so anything you can give to this project would be greatly appreciated! You all helped make my Derby Performance dreams come true! Please help me birth this baby of an album and send it out into the world!!!

My campaign goal is $9,000

The $9,000 goal is what we need for:

  • Rehearsal with the Band time
  • Rehearsal Space Rental
  • Recording Studio time (4 sessions)
  • Transportation
  • Music Mixing and Tech time
  • Fee for Artists participating 
  • Fee for a musicians participating 

And we have some amazing incentives for your contribution!

And of course ANY AMOUNT no matter how small will be greatly appreciated!  And if you can’t help at this time, help us spread the word to others who may be able to help! You guys rock!!

story:
Hello Friends of Dream Eternal Bliss!

If you're new to the music of Dream Eternal Bliss, we call our style progressive pop. We took some catchy influences from '80s new wave and fused them with the songwriting style of modern rock, then threw in some fantastic progressive rock musicianship to keep it all interesting. The result is a sound that feels familiar, yet you can't put your finger on any one thing because our overall sound is so unique!

The new record is a departure from the first EP as much as it's an evolution of the band's sound. We can't wait for you to hear how our songwriting and style has evolved! As some of you are aware, our original singer left the band shortly after the first record was released, and we lost a year's worth of momentum taking our time looking for just the right replacement. But when we found Faith, we knew that she would be the one to lead us into the next chapter. We released one single, "Bad Blood," last year to introduce our fans to the new voice of DEB, and the rest of the new record is even more exciting. We played some live shows in 2017, and then focused on writing the new record that we're super excited to share with all of you.

We are asking for your help to finance the mixing of our new record, to manufacture a limited number of physical CDs, and to help pay for the shooting of the record's first music video.

We've created a number of cool incentives to thank you for helping us with this new model of indie band music making, and any support will be truly appreciated and well received. Meanwhile, we're busy mixing the record and will be preparing for live shows soon.

story:
Short Summary

  • Night Crowned is a melodic black/death metal band from Sweden. All together our band members combined have played metal for well over 60 years, with over twenty official albums released by various labels and bands.
    This is our first self-funded album and I am sure that you know the music business well. After all, you live and breathe metal! So, you understand that if we get 100.000 plays on Spotify our cut will most likely consist of a slap in the face and kick in the balls (roughly calculated). That of course split across all the band members.
    We will not make a living from this album release, and we don't aim for that at this point either. We simply want to give this album the biggest possible impact on all social media platforms, in an effort to make this album reach as many people as possible.
    We are able to make a tidal wave in the metal scene with this album, and together we will make it a success! Even a small donation of your choice will make a huge difference for us.
    This is by far the best album we have ever recorded, so we really want to give this album the best possible push online that we can. To be able to do that, we need to create music videos and good content for social media. We already have the first two videos planned. In the picture shown above you get a small glimpse into the mood of the first video.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We as a band have already invested a lot of money in this album:
  • Recording
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Album art
  • Band photo sessions
  • Keyboard arrangements
  • Drum engineering and much more...

    And it doesn't stop there, we will also invest in these videos. But we need your help to reach the budget that we have set to be able to make these music videos into reality.
     
  • So, to reach the goal we have put up some special perks, like online Drum-, Guitar- and Screaming lessons with the band, some used gear from past and present bands, handwritten lyrics and some test prints for the upcoming album’s artwork.

Challenges

  • We will work hard to get the word out about this campaign, but we sure need your help also! So, feel free to share this campaign on your Facebook profile, in Facebook groups, in forums, on Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, your blog, spread in your email list, tell your friends in person while having a beer or whichever other ways you have available. We would really appreciate it! Also, feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    New to the band?
    Check them out here:
    https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBMWL5Semtdc36... 

    Or follow them here:
    https://www.facebook.com/nightcrowned/

After all, you live and breathe metal! So, you understand that if we get 100.000 plays on Spotify our cut will most likely consist of a slap in the face and kick in the balls (roughly calculated). That of course split across all the band members.We will not make a living from this album release, and we don't aim for that at this point either. We simply want to give this album the biggest possible impact on all social media platforms, in an effort to make this album reach as many people as possible.We are able to make a tidal wave in the metal scene with this album, and together we will make it a success! Even a small donation of your choice will make a huge difference for us.This is by far the best album we have ever recorded, so we really want to give this album the best possible push online that we can. To be able to do that, we need to create music videos and good content for social media. We already have the first two videos planned. In the picture shown above you get a small glimpse into the mood of the first video.

What We Need & What You Get

We as a band have already invested a lot of money in this album:
Recording
Mixing
Mastering
Album art
Band photo sessions
Keyboard arrangements

Drum engineering and much more...And it doesn't stop there, we will also invest in these videos. But we need your help to reach the budget that we have set to be able to make these music videos into reality. 
So, to reach the goal we have put up some special perks, like online Drum-, Guitar- and Screaming lessons with the band, some used gear from past and present bands, handwritten lyrics and some test prints for the upcoming album’s artwork.

ChallengesWe will work hard to get the word out about this campaign, but we sure need your help also! So, feel free to share this campaign on your Facebook profile, in Facebook groups, in forums, on Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, your blog, spread in your email list, tell your friends in person while having a beer or whichever other ways you have available. We would really appreciate it! Also, feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!New to the band?Check them out here:https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBMWL5Semtdc36... Or follow them here:https://www.facebook.com/nightcrowned/

story:
Hii :)

I just want you to know how much I appreciate you taking the time to even read this!

Whether this is the first time we’ve met or we’ve known each other since forever—thank you for being a part of this musical journey of mine! I’ve been dreaming of releasing an album since I first fell in love with writing songs at 12 years old, and I can’t tell you how crazy it is to be here, telling you all about this nearly-finished album I’ve worked on tirelessly ever since the idea of it was formed. 

This album is pretty much my baby now, and I’ve been doing everything in my power to make it the best it can possibly be! I’ve fallen in love with watching it come together, and with a little help from you, this project can be something I can share and enjoy with you and the rest of the world! Now, I’m not about to sit here and ask for your support without giving you something in return, so besides the album itself, I’ve put together something pretty special that I think you’re gonna like :) 

 

The Game Plan 

  • I’ve written and recorded 11 complete songs, and I’m going to send each of them to be professionally mixed and mastered by a very talented friend of mine!
  • And in order stretch this album as far as it can go, I will also be developing a marketing and promotional plan, complete with advertising, playlisting, and maybe some really cool videos if I can raise the funds!
  • I’m sure you can imagine that all this won’t be cheap, but I’ve been planning this for an INSANELY long time to ensure that every penny will be used to its fullest potential—It'll all be totally worth it! 

I obviously want to make sure that this is all worthwhile for you as well! That’s why I’ve prepared a bunch of different gift packages with stickers and shirts, designed completely around “Insult to Injury” and all that It’s about! (or not about?) 

 

Why?

On the surface, “Insult to Injury” can be interpreted as a 16-year-old girl dealing with a breakup by writing songs, and honestly that’s how it started so you weren’t too far off, haha! But as I tie up these last loose ends and see this project fully pull itself together, I can’t help but realize how much more it means. 

I realized that, as I continued writing, I wasn't just writing about the breakup—It wasn’t entirely about that. Insult to Injury was also heavily inspired by the heartbreak of losing so many people as a result of it. It’s about figuring out who you’ve got around you, and finding out who was never there to begin with. It’s about change—drastic changes at that—and realizing that you were never the one in control of your situation.  

And most importantly, Insult to Injury is about remembering Who is. 

Writing this album has been an incredibly healing process, and I can confidently say that I’ve finished it as a better person than I was before I began. I want nothing more than to share these songs with the people who have been in situations similar to mine (which is unfortunately nearly everybody hahaha) and I hope that they will bring you the same comfort they brought me :) 

 

Other (free-er) ways you can help! 

I totally get it—some people won’t be able to support the project financially. And that’s totally okay because there’s a ton more you can do to help me get this album out into the world! 

  • Easiest thing you can do is share this fundraiser with everyone you know! Family, friends, anyone who would be interested in helping out (or anyone who likes wearing cool shirts!) If you post about it on Instagram, tag me (@leila.dandan) because I’d love to see it! 
  • Hang out with me on social media! Not only will I be very happy to see you there, but every like, comment, follow, and share makes the algorithm very happy as well haha. My stuff will have more of a chance to be seen because of it!

story:
Summary:

In June, 2019, a group of musicians and I got together in Julian, CA. to make a live worship album. It was an incredible experience and the music that was made was life changing. You can learn more at http://www.katehurley.com/live-from-julian

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise an additional $2,000 dollars for mixing and promotion. 

 You can get great perks like previous albums, my book Cupid is a Procrastinator on prolonged singleness,  or even have a personalized  song written for you or a loved one. Or a house concert or guest leading worship at your church!

The Impact

We believe these songs will bring healing and hope to people. We believe that it will remind people of how deeply they are loved by God and will be a means to worship Him. 

Dozens of people have told me how much my past albums have impacted them, helping them through depressions, divorce and death. I believe this album will do the same. 

Risks & Challenges

We did an initial campaign which did well but I was planning on mixing the album myself. After we made the project I realized that it would be too difficult a challenge for me and that the music was so beautiful that we needed to get it professionally mixed and mastered. We are so grateful for this opportunity to finish our project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Join the Cause!

Join us in creating the eighth, full-length Ghoultown album.  This campaign, with your help, will allow us to continue making totally independent music, and bring you what we believe will be the ultimate Ghoultown release.  Ghoultown has built a worldwide fanbase since the band’s inception in 1999 and has always delivered a sound that is distinctive and original.   With Curse of Eldorado, the band will offer a new batch of songs that expands the sound to new levels while delivering our time-tested brand of upbeat rock, horrorpunk, western dirges, and gunslinging anthems. This campaign puts control in your hands, not only to fund the critical elements of recording and production, but to decide what formats YOU want.

To hear samples of our previous releases, visit www.ghoultown.com/music.htm

Curse of Eldorado will contain 13 songs and feature remakes of two Ghoultown classics!  It will be engineered and produced by Alex Gerst, the producer behind our previous album Ghost of the Southern Son.

If this campaign is successful, we will complete Curse of Eldorado and release in late October 2020. Join the posse and help us make the new album a reality!

What We Need and What You Get

The production of a quality album requires a significant amount of investment.  We are completely DIY with no label or outside help, so we depend on our fans and backers to support this effort.

Funds will be used to cover the following costs:

  • Recording time at the studio
  • Album mastering
  • Payment to the cover artist
  • Payment to the graphic designer for packaging layouts
  • Production of compact discs
  • Production of vinyl LPs
  • Production of a music video to help promote the album

Along with your choice of compact disc or vinyl, we’ve created some special merch for our backers including:

  • New T-Shirt
  • Etched Glass "Drink with the Living Dead" Flask (this option is SOLD OUT)

Other rewards include our working notes from the studio, guitar picks, drums heads, and other items used during the actual album recording, a copy of the vinyl test pressing, and a listening party with the band at the studio!  You can also choose to have YOUR NAME included on the liner notes, which will certainly be something to show your friends and family!  If you want to truly stand beside us on the front line, choose the Executive Producer credit.

If we do not reach our goal for funding all aspects of the album, we will refund any backing levels that cannot be fulfilled (such as options for the vinyl LP if we cannot afford the minimum vinyl order at the manufacturer).  So be sure to enlist all Ghoultown fans, and beyond, to support these efforts!

Why Back Us?

Your contribution is extremely important, and will ultimately determine if the album will be produced and released in all forms (cd, vinyl, etc.)  The music industry has been hit due to the worldwide pandemic and Ghoultown has not been immune to this.  We have no label or outside help, so we need you to help us overcome the current challenges and get this album produced.

Ghoultown has always delivered quality, well-produced albums and entertaining songs.  If this campaign is successful, Curse of Eldorado will be the next release in the catalog, and one that our backers can be proud of because YOU made it happen!

Other Ways You Can Help the Cause

If you cannot contribute, you can still help by getting the word out and sharing this campaign with music fans who might appreciate Ghoultown.

Indiegogo has share tools, so please use those to spread the word.

For more information on the band, visit www.ghoultown.com

story:
Short Summary

I have been playing classical guitar since I was nine and electric since I was thirteen. Music has been my  passion since then.

This  extraordinary  year has been bad in many ways but has also brought an opportunity for reflection and meditation. It has left us time to think on what really matters for us. In my case I have started to write rock songs and play the electric guitar again. At the same time, I have composed and re-arranged pieces for classical guitar as never before. 

This project is about bringing my two passions together, and I am offering you an  opportunity  to be part of this journey. The aim is to record two complete albums, one of my own compositions  for classical guitar, and another with rock songs inspired by the music I listened to and love from the 70s and 90s. Rock in its most pure  and savage form. The lyrics are bilingual, in English and Spanish. Some songs were written twenty years ago, but most of them are from 2020. For the Prog Rock LP Recording I count with the legend from Uruguay, Popo Romano in the bass and in the drums Rickard Jonsson from Sweden. Both musicians have already recorded three singles, to be released soon as a pre-launch of the final Double LP recording. 

About me

My name is Sebastián Caldas. I was born in Uruguay and moved to Sweden when I was just two years old.

I started playing a classical guitar in Malmö with Inger Alebo when I was nine and have not stopped since then.

Being the second youngest of five brothers and a sister I was very much influenced by their musical tastes , mainly heavy metal from the 80s and the vinyl albums of Herbert von Karajan directing Beethoven’s Symphonies  that my father listened to , as well as folk music from Latin America.

When I was twelve, I moved back to South America, and continued to study classical guitar with Anselmo Grau and Regina Carrizo

When I first heard Yngwie Malmsteen it blew my mind, so I borrowed an electric guitar , and formed a band. We played from Black Sabbath to Ugly Kid Joe, Megadeth and our own songs.

After high school I decided to focus on the classical guitar and the rock music was put on ice.

I got a Bachelor´s Degree from Musikene in classical guitar , having Marco Socías as teacher and a master’s degree from Musikhögskolan in Piteå with Jan-Olof Eriksson.

I have recorded so far two solo albums with the label

Daphne, distributed by Naxos, both with very good reviews from the

Swedish musical press. (read below).

( http://www.unt.se/inc/print/sjalslig-analys-for...

default.aspx http://www.gp.se/kulturnoje/musik/1.791569-seba...

negra). I have also received six grants from the Swedish Arts

Grants Committee and one from Musikverket. I love to work across genres.

My project Moving Horizons, a collaboration with percussionists from

the Candombe tradition, has toured Scandinavia and South America.

In 2016  I made  “Moving Horizons

meets Anty Ram trio”, working with musicians who use improvisation as

their main means of expression. The ensemble played in Oslo, at the

Copenhagen Jazz Festival, Stockholm, Malmö, and Borås.

My latest album, has been praised by the Swedish Guitar and Lute magazine for being a reference in Scandinavia for Latin American guitar music, as well as for being innovative in collaborating

with musicians from other traditions. In 2017 I toured Uruguay and Argentina with the “Moving Horizons meets Anty Ram trio” funded by the Swedish Arts Grants Committee.

In 2018 I got a grant from the Swedish Arts Grants Committee

To tour in Scandinavia together with Uruguayan tango singer Maia

Castro and pianist Horacio di Yorio.

“Sebastián Caldas takes care of a 20th century compositions in the Guitarra Negra Album

in a dynamic, dramatic and suggestive way” (4/5 Björn G Stenberg,Uppsalas Nya

Tidning)

4/5 (Björn G Stenberg, UNT)

www.unt.se/kultur/sjalslig----analys----for----...

“Sebastián Caldas, Guitarra Negra, a Guitarist to follow…”

(Ulf Johanson, Göteborgs Posten)

http://www.gp.se/kulturnoje/musik/1.791569----s...

P2 Musikrevyn, Swedish National Radio

“Zeballos’ passion is contagious” (Kalle Moraeus, Swedish violinist)

https://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?prog...

“Caldas’s concert was a major success both technically and musically and it displayed his sound,

rhythm and most importantly, the dynamic in his blood…” (Borås Tidning, Rolf Haglund)

Summary

2020 was a very bad year in many aspects. In my case it also brought an opportunity to meditate and redefine myself as an artist. 

One day I found a box with old songs I wrote a very long time ago. That same day I wrote Naia, the song that will be released as the first single. I continued to write songs and promised myself I would record my original compositions for guitar plus all the rock songs, old re-arranged and the new songs. For the Rock record I am aiming for an authentic sound inspired by the bands I listened to in the 90s and sounds from the 70s. That is the main reason for choosing Tambourine studio, a legendary studio with a special vintage sound based in Malmö.

This is where you come on the scene.  In order to make this dream come true I am asking you to be part of this trip. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to continue recording at the studio, paying the expenses for mixing, the musicians, mastering ,production, and promotion we are asking for your support. The release of a double album with classical guitar and rock music , played and composed by the same musician is quite unique and you can be part of it.

We have recorded three of the twelve songs and three solo pieces for classical guitar. These first three songs are already mixed and mastered and will be released as singles, starting the last week of January.

story:
Pige i spejlet, hvad venter du på?

Sådan lyder første linje af pladens allerførste sang. Modet svigter os alle fra tid til anden - når vi igen er klar, som jeg blev det, efter mange år med bl.a. en stemme der drillede - så vil vi også gerne hjælpe andre til at gøre det samme. Mine syv sange på pladen er en tur tilbage til mine erindringer, udfordringer og personlige aha-oplevelser, og det er mit håb, at andre vil kunne gøre brug af sangene til at lade sig inspirere og finde al deres mod frem. Jeg hedder Rie Hagbard, jeg er uddannet sanger og musikunderviser fra Rytmisk Musikkonservatorium, og jeg har her en hel kuffert fuld af hjertelige og livsbekræftende sange til jer!

God musik fortjener god lyd!

Og det gør de lyttende ører også. Jeg har været så heldig at få Gateway Music til at distribuere denne kommende plade, men økonomien står jeg helt selv for. Og der er mange udgifter i forbindelse med op-øvning, indspilning og musikproduktion. Jeg søger 10.000,-, som vil gå til leje af studiet, hvor sangene er blevet indspillet. Som støtte til mit projekt får du en masse retur: Du får naturligvis dit eget eksemplar af cd'en (som har release i efteråret 2018) og bliver krediteret med navns nævnelse. Dernæst er der andre musikalske forkælelser i vente, afhængigt af, hvilken beløbstørrelse, du vælger. Takkegaver såsom koncertbilletter til Rie Hagbard & trio, koncertbilletter til Rie Hagbard & Trio kombineret med drikkevarer, koncertbilletter til gospelkoncert, sangworkshop-gavekort og performance-gavekort. Skulle vi ikke være nået helt i mål med crowdfundingen, vil du ikke mærke noget til det; du modtager gaverne uanset udfaldet!

En tur tilbage går alle steder hen

I efteråret 2017 stod jeg med min pianist i Gl. Holte Kirke og opførte for første gang disse syv sange foran et publikum - og det blev en fantastisk aften med nærvær, glæde, grin, tårer og masser af genkendende nik og blikke rundt omkring fra tilskuerrækkerne. "En tur tilbage" rummer noget for enhver smag, og følelsesmæssigt bliver man bragt vidt omkring når man tager med på den lille rejse, pladen udgør. En koncertgæst udtaler:

"Så snart, jeg hørte de første sætninger sunget, blev jeg draget og fløj med på en magisk rejse. Nærmest som at sidde i den flyvende kuffert i Tivoli og få historier fortalt - sådan blev også jeg fløjet igennem et landskab af både smerte, håb og kærlighed. For mig er det musik, som virkelig fortjener at blive delt i verden."

Støt mit pladeprojekt hvis du elsker musik og gode tekster og hvis du har lyst til at hjælpe en kunstnerisk sjæl som min til at finde sit karrieremæssige springbræt og komme ud over kanten og sprede lys, stemning, glæde og genkendelighed blandt en masse mennesker. Og fordi verden aldrig kan få for meget dejlig, rørende og swingende musik. 

Har du ikke økonomisk mulighed for at støtte tilblivelsen af pladen, håber jeg at du vil hjælpe mig videre ved at dele nyheden om min crowdfunding på de forskellige medier, du har adgang til. Det i sig selv vil også være et stort bidrag! På forhånd tusind tak.

story:
Your support will help us with the following expenses as we prepare for The Village Halloween Parade and other Fall gigs:

Rehearsal studio rental

Drum heads, sticks, and supplies

Artwork for logo and tshirt design

Videographer and Editor to create a high quality video that we can use to promote our work.

Transportation: taxis, tolls and van rental to carry heavy drums

Reasonable fees for professional musicians to spend time learning and performing complex percussion music: many of the musicians who will perform in the parade are experienced professionals who deserve to be paid for their work.

**shin guards and knee pads for surdo (bass drum) players!!

La Conga is more than a band or another drumming group; it aims to work to spread about the word about the amazing phenomenon that is La Conga Santiaguera,  the unique and exciting sound of Santiago de Cuba's carnaval, to audiences throughout the United States.

We hope to provide low-cost and free community drumming workshops for participants of all ages and experience levels.

Workshop Videos:

Whenever possible we hope to connect students and enthusiasts with our mentors and maestros in Santiago de Cuba, the cradle of La Conga

story:
Hi Everyone!

I'm Rachael Fahim and I have been invited to perform at SXSW Festival - all the way over in Austin, TX. This is a huge opportunity for an aussie artist like me, and also a huge undertaking for me. Which is why I am hoping that you will get involved and help me and my band get from this little island over the Pacific Ocean and onto that stage in Texas.

SXSW is happening 11th-17th March 2019. It's one of the biggest festivals in the world helping emerging artists like me get onto the world stage, and for everyone who loves music it is right at the heart of our hearts! To even be invited means our hard work has paid off, but now I am asking for your help to actually get there. I wish it was as simple as jumping on the next flight...

We are looking for support to help us do this thing properly! To help arrange visas to perform, and to get our instruments (and ourselves) over to Austin safely. An appearance at SXSW also involves finding somewhere for me and my band to sleep at night, keeping the band alive and also putting our best foot forward to stand out amongst all the other acts there. 

Every little helps, and we want to try and give back to every person who gets involved! Check out the perks of the campaign (hint: look just a little to your right...) for what I want to send you to say thank you for your support. From a simple but heartfelt thank you note, right through to an incredible package of merch plus money-can't-buy opportunities! Even if you can't make a pledge, please feel free to get involved by spreading the word - and even just listening to my music.

Thank you to everyone who has already helped us on our way - you are all incredible! 

I'll see you Texas!

Rachael x

story:
Short Summary

I grew up outside New York City, and was fortunate to be surrounded by the the arts.  My father was a concert booking agent, and my mother an artist.  There was always a variety of music playing in our house, particularly the classic Broadway musicals of the 50s and Jazz.  Early influences include my dad's clients Preservation Hall Jazz Band and Carlos Montoya. This background led me to pursue degrees in music at Bard College and NYU, where I created everything from piano sonatas to computer generated pieces based on fractals. 

While my songwriting fits within the broad "modern folk" category, I believe what sets it apart are the subtle influences from my jazz and chamber music experiences that come through.  Arcadia is  my most multi-textured record to date, and includes a great array of singers and musicians including Jud Caswell (producer/guitar), Bill Holden (dobro), Colin Kolmar (percussion), Jim Lyden (bass), Alex Millan (bass), Kevin Oates (cello), Janice O'Rourke (vocals), and Ben Hunsberger (organ, piano). 

Our goal is to raise $3,000  to help to make sure we can finalize the recording, mixing, mastering and manufacturing of this record, and have it in hand when I attend the 2018 NEFRA conference, the 2nd weekend of November.  Having something brand new to offer will be a great way to pique the interest of the presenters and DJ's I will be meeting there.  

I appreciate the opportunities I have had to perform regularly in Maine over the past 15+ years, as well as the recognition my songs have received: "Change" from Arcadia is a finalist in the 2018 Maine Songwriter's Association Song Competition, and I placed 3rd in the 2016 competition, I was also an 8-time finalist in the New England Songwriting Awards.  However, I believe now is the time to introduce my music to a wider audience and let these songs realize their greater potential.

This record will get made eventually with or without your help, but it will take longer if I am funding it on my own.  And believe it or not, I have material for another record waiting in the wings, so let's get it done and out there for the world (or at least New England) to hear, so I can sell a few, get some new gigs to generate funds to pay for the next one so I don't have to ask for your help! :-)

What do you get out of all this? The main thing is you will be the first ones to have the record in your hands, but depending on what you contribute there are a range of other additional goodies ranging from a complete collection of lyrics from all the songs I've recorded since 2004, to a live concert in your living room. 

I understand not everyone is in a position to make a monetary contribution, but you can still help-- -please spread the word - tell your friends - share on social, etc.  THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys! My name is Deborah Puig and I am a solo violinist hailing from Fredericksburg, Virginia. This will be my first ever original album, and I am super stoked to be able to work on this with Asher at Kingship Recording. However, in order to reach my goal, I’ll need the help from all of my wonderful supporters!

What We Need & What You Get

As any soloist, I am a 100% DIY artist. I am starting off without management, funding all of my videos, promotional material, and musical endeavors on my own.

My goal is to raise $4,000 that will go towards this album. That includes:

- Full production of 12 songs with Asher Condit in Avon, CT (Pre-Production, Recording, Mixing and Mastering)

- CD Duplication 

- Costs of any IndieGoGo Perks and Rewards (Shipping and Handling, the costs of creating some of these prizes, etc)

Any money raised over the $4,000 will go towards:

-My music video for an original song

-Funding an album release party that everyone will be able to attend

I am so incredibly excited to be doing this, and even more excited to include all of my friends, family, and supporters as I start of on this musical journey. As a shoutout to all those that support and back me on this project and future projects to come, I will be offering special prizes and packages!

 

The Impact

This LP will be a huge milestone for me as I finally start down a path to chase my dreams of inspiring the world. Every contribution, no matter how small it may seem to some, can make a huge difference. It tells me that not only do I have such wonderful people supporting me, but that I CAN make a difference.

 

Risks & Challenges

Being a solo artist has many risks and challenges, especially on the financial front. I, like most, have bills to pay, and cannot put all of my earnings into this project to make it take wing, as much as I would like to. It is also not something that happens overnight, there are other people involved with this project, spending their time and resources towards this. However, with the support and love I have received, it has given me the strength to pursue this at whatever cost it may be. With your help, we can do anything, even change the world with music.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any donation amount helps me towards this goal, but if you're unable to donate, sharing and spreading around my Indiegogo video goes a long way! Anytime you share my cover video, indiegogo video, or even my page with friends and family it goes a long way towards supporting my project. Any way that you guys can support will help me and I love you all!

story:
The Band

Says Things is an electroacoustic duo consisting of Derek Worthington on trumpet and laptop, and Jon Taylor on drums and percussion. The pared down instrumentation allows space for electronic explorations of timbre and texture, taking the sound of the acoustic instruments to the breaking point. We've been playing together as Says Things for about three years, and in other configurations much longer. Over the years we've developed a deep rapport and a unique improvisational language. You can listen to two (unmastered) tracks from the album here!

The Album

The album is fully recorded and mixed. We have the incredible engineer Jim Roll lined up to do the mastering, and the amazing multimedia artist Simon Alexander Adams is working on the album art. We're immensely excited about releasing these recordings in physical form. They sound great, and we really just want to share them with as many people as possible; hence the indiegogo campaign. We're thinking of this as a preorder as opposed to crowdfunding, so we're not adding a bunch of crazy "perks" - basically just the album! This is about getting our music out there, and offsetting the costs of production, as opposed to making money.

The Goal & The Perks

    Our goal is to raise $2000, which will cover everything we have yet to do - mastering, album art, and CD printing. To that end, you can order digital downloads, physical CDs, and there's an option that includes 4 bonus tracks (audio) from our recent video recording sessions! There's also an option that includes Derek's previous CD Lovely Properties - an album of creative jazz & improvised music for large ensemble.

    If we don't meet our full goal, the album is still being made. We'll have to pay the extra costs out of pocket - but all contributors will receive what they paid for.

    Thank You!

      Please share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested! That's every bit as helpful as preordering a CD. Thank you!

story:
Who We Are

The Bloomington Early Music Festival (BLEMF) is an annual series of concerts that celebrates historically informed performances and workshops by local, regional, and national performers and theorists. The festival is project of Bloomington Early Music, a registered 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization.

What We Do

As one of the few festivals in the country, and the only one in Indiana, we strive to present the highest quality early music experiences our Bloomington audiences. Since 2004, BLEMF has produces a wide array of musical genres dating back more than four hundred years. Featured ensembles are selected from around the nation and also include faculty, students and alumni from Indiana University Jacobs School of Music’s renowned Historical Performance Institute. This year’s festival should be our best yet, with concerts in the courthouse, performances on the IU campus and local church venues, as well as the annual Early Music instrument petting zoo!

Why We Need You

The festival is made possible in large part by generous contributions of individuals and partnering organizations. We invite you to join us by contributing towards our goal of $4,000. No matter the size of the pledge, each gift helps tremendously.

GIVING OPPORTUNITIES

DESIGNATED GIVING

  • $100 – pay for musicians’ rehearsal meal
  • $200 – help pay for festival visiting ensemble
  • $400 – pay for travel for one guest artist
  • $400 – pay for one guest artists’ concert honorarium
  • $400 – help pay for festival event recording

GENERAL CONTRIBUTIONS

All contributors are invited to our annual donor reception.

GIFTS

  • Friend: $50
    Your Name will be included in the program book.

All the following gifts include an acknowledgement in the program book, CDs and optional website acknowledgement

  • Supporter: Up to $99
  • Sustainer: $100-249
  • Underwriter: $250-$499
  • Producer: $500 and up

story:
The Group!

Tapestry, a chamber choir named for the diversity woven into its musical styles, periods, and membership, was founded in January 2014. Since its inception, Tapestry has grown tremendously and taken on a variety of projects, including:

  • Performances of choral ballet "Vigil," with Claudia Schreier Choreography at Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater and the Joyce Theater.
  • Concerts of increasing artistry, which have included World, Spiritual, Classical, Renaissance, Folk, and Gypsy music.
  • Commission of Colin Britt's "I think awhile of Love," a choral piece set to a poem by Henry David Thoreau. This piece was commissioned to promote love and acceptance.

And now we need your help with our next project!

LET'S RECORD!

For the past year, Tapestry has been preparing to record its first studio album! Much in the spirit of the group, this recording will include a variety of styles and time periods, including:

  • New music by young composers, including Colin Britt, Jake Runestad, and Jason McCoy
  • Modern choral music by Morten Lauridsen and Stephen Paulus
  • Four Motets by Maurice Duruflé

The Purpose

As always, Tapestry wishes to promote choral music as a genre that is rich, vibrant, and fun. Your support would help get our voices out to the world beyond New York City.

In addition, through recording music by young, living composers, we hope to promote new music and further choral commissions. 

Your help matters

Recording an album is no small project. By donating, you will help us to afford:

  • Space in which to record the music
  • A team of professionals to engineer the recording
  • Licensing for the pieces 
  • Marketing and production once the album is done

All donations are tax-deductible and you will receive receipt via email within 5-7 days of donating.

SPREAD THE WORD!!!

Become a fighter for the choral cause! Please share this campaign through Facebook, Twitter, and by word of mouth! 

And please visit us at www.tapestrychoir.org and facebook.com/tapestrychoir

story: My name is Nina and I am 27 years old. I have been writing music and songs for loved ones and for people who need to be lifted. When I was a child I used to write music on a small tape recorder but electronics became big in the music industry and the tape recorder became obsolete. For 8 years I have been writing music on an old computer that has served me well with recording, scoring and writing music that has helped bring joy to others. Six months ago my computer broke down and I have not been able to record or score since. I have been trying to save for a new computer but have been having much trouble. My grandfather passed and instead of working I have been spending a lot of time with my grandmother to help her get through this horrible time for her. I am hoping to raise enough money to help me fund a new computer so that I can record and score more music so that I can bring joy and happiness to others through the art of music. I plan score music for videos dedicated to those who are less fortunate, have been bullied, are going through hard times and more. I want to help spread the word to help and love one another through music and other forms of art.

story:
WHY DO SOME PEOPLE FEEL FRAZZLED, ISOLATED AND BURNT OUT,

WHILE OTHERS STAY CALM AND CONNECTED, NO MATTER WHAT?

What's the idea?

Amidst terrifying talk of nuclear threat, doom and destruction, a positive atomic energy is being revived in the heart of Galilee, Israel, giving a comforting feeling of Instant Calm. A powerful application of sound waves, as used in pre-biblical times for healing and transformational purposes.  

What secrets does our past hold for our health and wellbeing today?

Share an ancient healing and transformational tool used for deep  calm, relaxation, rejuvenation, focus and clarity, especially during turbulent times of change. 

In ancient times the atomic use of sound was recognized as a powerful healing & transformational tool. There was strong cosmic connection with ancient sites and structures. Though this power, rooted in the irresistible magnetic force, has been largely forgotten for the last 3000 years, it is my life's work to revive these secrets for our benefit today.

Who am I and what is Voices of Eden? 

My name is Eliana Gilad, Founder of Voices of Eden Ancient Healing & Transformational music, author of forthcoming "Miriam's Secret, Discovering Your Inner Well of Wisdom".

A former CBS broadcaster with an extensive academic and practical background in history, archaeology, ancient music and the University of Life, it's been my passion to rediscover this ancient music modality, prove its power by pioneering international medical research, and find practical applications for it to make our world a better place for all today.

Why do I call my discovery “Voices of Eden”?  Imagine what will happen as individuals connect to their inner truth, listen to their authentic voice, trust it and express it. Each voice gets heard and creates a united whole. Voices of Eden is a practical experiment of creating Eden on earth.

Now's the time to spread the word! 

My team and I have been invited to present at the International Archaeology & Music Conference in China 21-25 October 2012, and at TEDxVail Women Conference in USA  first week of December 2012.

Voices of Eden music empowers and inspires transformation as we reconnect with the magnetic feminine power found at the earth's core. Ancient healing and transformational music was practiced in the ancient near east to help people remain balanced and focused during times of change.  Unique and universal, a bridge between East and West, this sonic healing application is being revived today for modern use.

What's the plan?

1)  We have planned a live event this month at an ancient healing music site in Galilee which will attune folks to the magnetic energy of the spot as we demonstrate a live application of this special music.

2) We'll record perfectly imperfect human voices crooing a Cosmic Melody, which I composed at the turn of the Millenium, inspired by a collaboration with Barbara Marx Hubbard and her unique "Attuner" instrument, tuned to the vibratory rate of the earth's rotation. 

3) We'll prepare a multi-media presentation incorporating the recording from the live event.

4) We'll travel to China and the US to the International Conferences we are invited to with this presentation, to share the experience of this ancient healing and transformational music modality, with its keys to improve our lives today.

5) We have been invited by the International Music Archaeology Conference organizers to present a reconstructed Ancient Musical Instrument by Israeli world authority Moshe Frumin www.moshefrumin.com, which will be played at the Concert of Restored Ancient Musical Instruments at the Conference in China.

How can you help?

We have invested $10,000 of our personal money (not including our time) to seed this project, so that you and 1000s of others can experience its power too.  

We now need $8000 to get to China and the US, and to produce the live recording and multi-media presentation. All our expenses are paid once we get there.

Here's how the $8,000 will be spent:

2 return flight tickets to China and USA from Israel. (Event organizers in China and USA are covering our expenses once we arrive ) - $5,000.

Organizing, recording and filming the live event at an ancient healing music site in Galilee, Israel, to demonstrate a practical application of this atomic use of sound - $1,300.

Producing a multi-media presentation including video editing, graphics, website, handouts for the prestigeous International Events in Suzhou, China and Vail, USA - $1,700.

We promise that all funds raised will go directly to record and film this Ancient Healing Music modality, and to enable us to travel to present this music live world-wide, so we can spread the word about the revival of the secret keys to calm and focus. 

If we do not reach the target, we won't be able to take up the invitations to present at the conferences.

If we exceed the target, we will be able to invest more and improve the quality of the presentation material, and travel to more destinations to give live workshops.

Why support us?

By supporting us in funding this project so we can present at the Conferences, it’s a chance for you to experience Voices of Eden music, to listen to and express your unique voice as we encourage you to sing along and feel the healing benefits from the inside out. To describe more specifically:

We will produce, record and film a unique event at an ancient archaeological healing site in Galilee, Israel where regular people will gather to learn the powerful Cosmic Melody, and sing 100% naturally, no synthesizers, no "performance", but truly authentic power. 

The recording and film of the event will be incorporated in a multi-media presentation to be shown at the prestigious International Conferences of Music & Archaeology in Suzhou and Beijing, China, and at TEDxVail Women in Colorado, USA.

We will present at these events as invited, and give full credit to all our supporters in our PR and at the events, and as this material spreads around the world.

We've been spreading the word, now it's time for more

We've presented 3 times at the United Nations, being cited "for helping so many people all over the world" and in Beijing, China last year, exploring the strong healing music ties between ancient China and ancient Israel.

We're passionate about spreading this medically proven ancient healing music modality to help you and and many others as possible world-wide today.

Sometimes slow can be the fastest route, and less is more. Attuned to the magnetic core, We are here to provide a safe environment so that each voice can be heard and appreciated. 

Each voice truly makes a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

At this auspicious time of change when we see all around us that "the old world has left the building", let your voice be heard. It really makes a difference in changing the world:

  • Spread the word and let everyone know about our campaign. The ripple effect is real.
  • Visit our website www.voicesofeden.com and experience Ancient Healing & Transformational Music for yourself. When you feel calmer, sleep better, and your world around you is better for you, so it will be for everyone.
  • Encourage your friends to share on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn

Please join us… together we will form
The Voices of Eden – one voice at a time

 

Your Voice Truly Makes A Difference

story:
Who I am, What I plan

My name is Jaden Larue. For now you can call me, "little bird."  I wanted a name that properly represented the feel-good, spirited, upbeat music I've been writing for this album and thus, little bird was born.  I've been in music nearly my entire life and while I've been performing and writing for years, I feel it's finally time to put my music into your hands in the hopes that you will help me share it with the world.  

 

 THE DETAILS

I need to raise $5000.00 to make this project possible.  

This includes all costs of recording, paying the amazing musicians, mixing, mastering, artwork, video, CD pressing, posters, shipping,etc.  

If you help me raise more than the $5000, that money will go to touring as well as assisting me in recording a second EP.  I have so much music to share with ya'll I just can't fit it all on one CD!  

 MY ULTIMATE GOAL 

The way I envision this Little Bird project working out is this:  Not only will I have beautiful new music to put in your hands and share with the world, but I would like to see my music get placed in TV and Film. I've definitely written the most perfect catchy song for a cough syrup commercial, haha.  I've also written music that has the ability to reconnect you to your heart and when placed on the soundtrack to next year's best movie, I want it to be the song that's stuck in your head as you leave the theater.  

Also, I want my music to have a positive impact on the world and will allow it to be used/sold to raise money for various charitable organizations.  

 LET'S BE THE CHANGE IN THE WORLD

In difficult times, there are the folks that run from the tragedies in the world and there are those who quickly run toward them to offer their love and assistance.  I try to be one of those people who run toward the darkness; to offer a helping hand. I want my music to be a part of that.

little bird is the kind of music that puts you in an uplifted mental space.  It's the kind of music that cheers you up or is the perfect soundtrack to a roadtrip.  The songs are ones that remind us of the lighter side of life and help us carry that lightness into the darker moments.

Your contribution = my ability to fund this music project and pay the amazing artists, musicians and sustainable companies that I will be working with from beginning to completion.  

 OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Help me share this campaign and my future music by posting this to your Facebook Pages, your Websites, Tweet about it, Instagram, Blog...whatever you can do to help is greatly appreciated.

FOLLOW ME!

twitter: @littlebirdband

instagram: @singlittlebird

www.singlittlebird.com

I'm continuously overwhelmed by the love and support I get from friends and strangers for my music. I AM GRATEFUL. Love is a two-way street so if there's ever any way in which I can support you... send me a message!  xx
