story:
Join Me!

My news studio recording is ready to be released!
It has 11 new songs that were fully produced by myself and David Peters in his beautiful Southern California studio. 
It also contains  3 instrumental guitar songs which I composed. Releasing instrumental songs is new for me, but I've been evolving my solo guitar playing over the past few years and felt like these pieces really fit with this series of songs.
Click on the Updates tab to see song samples you can listen to. I'll be posting them every few days. There's one already up there.
The only thing left is to print the CD's, which is why I'm here on indiegogo asking for your help to make that possible!
The CD's are scheduled to be delivered on December 10, 2015. I will send out CD's to anyone who has ordered them by Dec. 14  even if the campaign isn't over. This is safely within the deadline UPS and USPS for a Christmas delivery, if that is important to you.

What I'm Offering

I am offering the traditional option of buying one CD, but I also am offering the ability to buy a stack of these CD's at a greatly reduced price to give as holiday gifts. 
Or really any kind of gift. 
Sharing indie and affordable music with friends, family, co-workers and neighbors is the goal!
With the help of photographer Jessica Greaux and the multi-talented visual artist Lindsay Elgin, I have designed an 11x17 poster that contains all the album lyrics, and can be folded up into a neat booklet. 
If I don't reach my entire fundraising goal, don't worry. You will still get your CD in the mail just the same. I will just absorb the additional cost myself.

Please be an Early Bird! 

If you are one of my early supporters in this campaign, please choose the early bird offers as these are where I've given the best discount on my offers. I really really want you to have an affordable way to have a stack of my CD's to give away as gifts.

Night Owl? No problem!

Never fear. My later supporters will still have reduced price perks available to them as well. 

Why I'm so excited to share this project with my community

I love writing music, arranging it and recording it in a studio. I love challenging myself to write jazz influenced harmonies on the guitar that still fit into the genre of folk and pop acoustic music.  

And one of the magical parts about studio recording is you have the ability to write and record richly layered vocal harmonies to fill out a song.  So I'm very excited to share these arrangements with you. 

Also, on this album I got to work with a bunch of amazing artists. David Peters is a highly sought after engineer and producer based out of LA, and this is my second project with him. Since he is also songwriter himself, his style of working in the studio is powerful and one of a kind.

I also go to work with Jimmy Paxson on drums  (currently playing with Ben Harper), Mike Valerio (LA Philharmonic and a huge list of movie and TV scores), and Julie Wolf on keys (who is the songwriter's favorite pianist, most recently with Carly Simon), as well as a handful of other great musicians.


Risks & Challenges

The album has already been recorded, mixed, mastered and designed. 

So at this stage of the game the risks are pretty minimal. 

However, I suppose it is possible that a huge nor'easter will dump 5 feet of snow on the CD factory in New Jersey and delay the CD's being printed. And, while the goal is to have CD's in your hands by 12/25, if either the CD factory or the US Postal Service is delayed then you might get your shipment a few days late. 

I don't see these as being major risks. But if you are counting on these arriving by 12/25, it is possible they'll be a few days late.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you back this campaign or not, please share this with your friends who enjoy acoustic singer-songwriter music. 

There are sharing tools on this website you can use. Or you can send them an old fashioned email with a link to this site. Or tell your friend at work. Or that neighbor you run into while you're walking your dog. You get the drift... Your help is greatly appreciated!

Not sure who might like my music? I have been told that people who like my music tend to also like the music of Jonatha Brooke, Dar Williams, Kathleen Edwards, K'eb Mo, India Arie, Ani DiFranco, Kris Delmhorst, Peter Mulvey, and/or Erin McKeown.

Won't be Streaming

Nope. Spotify, pandora or iTunes will not have this album for the foreseeable future.  Just good ol' fashioned CDs! (Ok, they're not that old fashioned. But you get my point.)
story_txt:
Join Me!
 My news studio recording is ready to be released!It has 11 new songs that were fully produced by myself and David Peters in his beautiful Southern California studio. It also contains  3 instrumental guitar songs which I composed. Releasing instrumental songs is new for me, but I've been evolving my solo guitar playing over the past few years and felt like these pieces really fit with this series of songs.Click on the Updates tab to see song samples you can listen to. I'll be posting them every few days. There's one already up there.The only thing left is to print the CD's, which is why I'm here on indiegogo asking for your help to make that possible!The CD's are scheduled to be delivered on December 10, 2015. I will send out CD's to anyone who has ordered them by Dec. 14  even if the campaign isn't over. This is safely within the deadline UPS and USPS for a Christmas delivery, if that is important to you.
What I'm OfferingI am offering the traditional option of buying one CD, but I also am offering the ability to buy a stack of these CD's at a greatly reduced price to give as holiday gifts. Or really any kind of gift. Sharing indie and affordable music with friends, family, co-workers and neighbors is the goal!
With the help of photographer Jessica Greaux and the multi-talented visual artist Lindsay Elgin, I have designed an 11x17 poster that contains all the album lyrics, and can be folded up into a neat booklet. If I don't reach my entire fundraising goal, don't worry. You will still get your CD in the mail just the same. I will just absorb the additional cost myself.    
Please be an Early Bird!  If you are one of my early supporters in this campaign, please choose the early bird offers as these are where I've given the best discount on my offers. I really really want you to have an affordable way to have a stack of my CD's to give away as gifts.

Night Owl? No problem!
Never fear. My later supporters will still have reduced price perks available to them as well. 

Why I'm so excited to share this project with my communityI love writing music, arranging it and recording it in a studio. I love challenging myself to write jazz influenced harmonies on the guitar that still fit into the genre of folk and pop acoustic music.

story:
Paper Waves is a project based on collaboration in songwriting, support, leadership, and goofy shenanigans. Our talented, all-female lineup, consisting of Bridget Duggan, Christiana Usenza, Lorie Lin, Gabrielle Otto, and Jane Carter, is well-versed in a variety of instruments and musical backgrounds, with a diverse instrumentation that includes guitar, cello, ukulele, keys, drum set, vox, and the cajon! As trained musicians since youth, we have all been playing music either professionally or for fun for most of our lives, but it wasn’t until Paper Waves that we discovered our passion and excitement for writing and collaboration. The group inspires us to push our preconceived limits and hone our musicianship through songwriting, practicing and performing. 

Our dynamic, fun and energizing chemistry has resulted in the creation of an abundance of many new tunes, varying in style, from sexy and humorous (“Tiger Song”), to heartfelt (“The Night”), good ol’ bluesy (“Play It Cool”), to sweet folk (“The Space”), upbeat rock (“White Flag,” “Fire Inside”), and melancholic pop (“Seas Apart”). These songs are slated for our debut album, and hopefully with a little help from you, we'll be able to make this project a reality!

This campaign is raising funds for Paper Waves' first professionally recorded self-titled album with producer Mike Davidson in Boston. We are so excited to have this opportunity to record our favorite original songs. We've already recorded "The Night," which is available for free streaming now (see the YouTube video directly below). Although each of our songs are unique, “The Night” gives a taste of the kind of recording we'll be able to create if this campaign is successful. If we reach our goal, we will be able to get back into the studio to record the whole album! Our budget also accounts for funding the additional costs of being an independent band, like CD pressing, merchandise, and promotion.

The success of this campaign will be a defining moment in our career as a band and as individuals. A professional recording of our work will open doors for us, allow us to share our music with wider audiences, and bring to life all of our hard work and collaboration that we’ve all been so fortunate to be a part of. We have an abundance of original music that we would love to share with you and we hope that you can help us create this project and bring it to your ears!

The expenses for a professional quality recording add up quickly. We have covered the costs of recording “The Night” on our own, and now we need your support to make the rest of the album a reality.

Your donation through this campaign will go toward covering the following expenses:

1. Pre-production & producer fees

2. Studio time for recording, mixing, & mastering

3. CD pressing & promotion



We are so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign, and in exchange for your generosity, we've created some fun and special gifts available exclusively through your participation in our campaign, like T- shirts, signed CDs and posters, private concerts, lessons, etc. You can donate by selecting a "perk" on the right-hand side of this page and clicking the pink "contribute now" button. Remember, every dollar counts! Thanks again for checking out our campaign and we really hope you enjoy it!

A LITTLE MORE ON PAPER WAVES...

The group has roots from over a decade ago when Lorie (guitar) and Gab (drums) were in high school together in Vermont playing in an all-girl rock band. Years later, they found themselves in Boston and decided to bring music back into their lives (which had been swallowed by their professional day jobs, in marketing and finance).

In 2012 fate brought them together with Bridget (vocals, songwriting) who wanted to try her hand at singing lead vocals in a band after being trained in music and theater her whole life.  With the support of the group, Bridget discovered her talent for songwriting.

Bridget invited Christiana (keys, drums, vocals, songwriting) into the band in early 2014 to add the layers of vocal harmonies, keys and songwriting talents. After a few fun rehearsals together, they realized they had great musical chemistry and switched their focus to creating original songs.

Christiana soon invited Jane (cello) into the group, whom she knew from grad school. The sound was instantly solidified and new music has been pouring out of them at a rate not even they can keep up with! Now the time has come to record and capture their songs into a timeless and tangible professional recording before the songs disappear into space, or the polar vortex -- who knows what could happen if we don’t capture them now!

story:
Short Summary

We are a central PA based original Rock band consisting of guitarist Matt Shaub, vocalist/lyricist Dave Seyfried, bassist Michael Gingrich, and drummer Clayton Stief. We recorded a professional album this past summer and are just trying to raise a little more moola to get our lovely cd's pressed. Check us out at https://soundcloud.com/ultrahawaiiansuccessstory

What We Need & What You Get

We need approximately $1000 dollars to get our cd's pressed and for some basic merchandise to travel with as we embark on playing out as much as we can. At each level you will get your own pro-pressed CD and as you contribute more you will qualify for other merchandise, private live shows,original artwork by Dave (www.popoffthepage.com) , or even an amazing song written about you.

The Impact

We have already developed a decent small local following and have played many small shows. So far it people really dig freaking out to our super sound, but they also find our songs very inspiring as well. We want to develop our musical "band/fan" camaraderie beyond our area including Philadelphia, Baltimore, and beyond. Your small contribution will give us the travelling "shoes" we need to accomplish this.

Music comes naturally to us,we love people, and want to augment their lives while rocking their faces off.

Unfortunately this quality rock music merch stuff can cost allot and we are running out of moolah. We feel the world needs us out there (though we trully don't mean that in a cocky way).

Each of our members has had excellent experience playing live before hundreds of people over the years and have also had radio airplay in some large areas (just so you know this isn't just a pipe dream).

Risks & Challenges

We have had some challenges over the last year keeping a set member lineup together because of members' conflicting schedules and the like. We are glad to say we have the real deal lineup that musically and personally mesh well at last.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would also love your help telling folks about us, you to listen to our music, club suggestions, your liking us on Facebook, and your real life friendship too.


And that's all there is to it.

story:
Apollo House is a rock and roll band based in Chicago, and we are about to release our first record! We just finished recording at RaxTrax Recordings in Chicago with producer/engineer Noam Wallenburg, and it's sounding amazing! We're more than excited to get these songs out to you, but, WE NEED YOUR HELP!!!

Now that we have completed the recording, we have to finish a few more steps before we can reach our goal of releasing this record. We have to press, manufacture, and distribute the record, as well as get our album artwork completed. So we need our fans, friends, and family to help us by donating to this campaign so we can get to release on schedule. As a special prize for helping us move this record along, we have some awesome perks that we are excited to give you guys as a thank you for donating! 

**Even if you can't donate you can still help!!!!**

If your pockets are a little dusty no problem- you can still help us by spreading the word about our new record and this campaign! A simple "Like" "Share" or status update about what we are doing with this campaign is HUGE for us!! The more people who can see our campaign and donate to this project, the sooner we can get this record out to you!! Thanks to all who have supported our band thus far and those of you who continue to support us- we couldn't do this without you guys!! Check us out on Facebook, Twitter, and Youtube to see more videos, and stay updated on our debut record!!

story:
WE HAVE RECENTLY LAUNCHED OUR NEW EP!! HELP US GET OUR MUSIC OUT INTO THE WORLD!

For the past year and a half we have been feverishly working on recording and releasing an EP and launching our new band, Daughter & Son. It has been a long and careful process trying to make it happen, and we made sure to put the time and hard work into doing it right.  Thankfully, the time has come to share Daughter & Son with all of you!

On March 26th our self titled EP was born into this world and, just like any baby, we want to take good care of it so it can grow up to be big and strong. Pledging to our campaign will help us create a loving home, supportive family and a nurturing environment for it to learn how to stand and walk on it’s own two legs. Since we have no record label or independent funding behind us, we plan on taking do-it-yourself to a whole new level, and we need your help!

HOW IT WORKS:

You pick from one of the 11 amazing perks we have offered on this page. The monetary amount from that perk is donated to our campaign. At the end of the campaign, we send you everything promised in the perk you chose. Its that simple!

WHAT YOUR MONEY WILL BE USED FOR:

  • Press and Marketing – How often is it that you are reading your favorite paper, magazine or blog, and a picture or headline jumps off the page and catches your eye? Have you ever discovered a new band from reading the latest buzz or from checking out a new video or song they just released? These artists arrive at your fingertips because they have people who work hard to get them there. And as in any business, the better the person is at the job, the more you have to pay them. The majority of your pledges will be used to hire a heavy hitting Press Representative to get Daughter & Son known, seen and heard, where it counts.
  • Touring – The most important piece of the puzzle for any band is performing and gaining new fans through playing shows in cities and regions outside of where they are based. We want to come and perform in a town near you! However, touring costs are high with travel expenses, lodging and the cost of living while on the road. Another portion of the money you donate will help us cover these costs so we can meet and play for all of you in the very near future. Please let us know in what cities you’d like to see us play!
  • Promotional Materials – The best way to discover anything new is word of mouth. Since we are a brand new band, we need to get our music and name out there to as many people as we can. This means we will need fun things to sell. From stickers to posters to t-shirts to tote bags to underwear to you name it – we want to get it out and into your hands. Let us know what type of merchandise you’d like us to make so we can decorate you in D&S style.
  • EP Production Costs – Even though our EP is finished and we were able to make it without spending too much money, it did cost us quite a bit to have the actual EP’s reproduced so you can get your own copy through CD Baby shipped into your very own hands. Part of the money you donate will be used to pay off these expenses and also to help us begin recording our next EP, Daughter & Son – Volume 2, which we hope to have out by Fall, 2013. 

During this campaign we will be keeping you updated about the tours we’re planning, the songs we’re writing and recording, and we’ll also send you treats and free gifts the more you help us spread the word to your family and friends to help us reach our goal. We want to hear from you and so we can share our exciting journey with you every step of the way. Thank you so much!

story:
some pretty delicious things have happened since that fateful day 4 years ago, when months after just starting to teach myself guitar and have songs spill out, YouTube featured me on their homepage as the "Unsigned Pick of the Week" ...
 

3 albums ... press and interviews that still totally feel surreal ... tours where i figured out that i wanted coming to my show to feel like me having friends over in my living room.

and now, i've got new songs to share. want to check out my music?

watch the "Country Boy" Official Music Video

listen to the whole  "Written On" album for free! (feat. my cousin Victor Wooten on 2 tracks!)

hear my new single, "Join Forces"

watch a performance video from a show in NYC

i have a story to tell!  one that'll unfold in 5 parts ... little squadrons of a handful of songs each, marching into your heart, each chapter building into the next, every few months for the next year and a half or so.  

it's a story of love. and a relentless commitment to being together.

i'm raising $7,000 to record these 5 EPs in a NYC studio where i feel very much at home, where i know these songs will morph like transformers into music that truly sounds like living. the $7,000 will cover:

  • studio time

  • mixing & mastering the songs

  • printing & packaging CDs

  • paying a little something to my insane musicians who'll be trapped in a small room with me for countless hours

  • and finally, it'll give us a tiny promotion budget to spread the music to as many beautiful humans as we can

yep! once the songs are recorded & ready, one EP will be released every few months on a "pay what you'd like" basis! it's a new model for music.

it's like a dinner party - i LOVE cooking the food and can't wait for you to show up and just eat. but hey, if you want to help out by bringing dessert, i'd be super happy! ... i love dessert :) so when you download the songs, you'll be able to write in how much you'd like to pay - whether that's $0 if you're strapped for cash or $100 if you're feeling give-y!

*all perks $25 and over include a signed hard copy + digital downloads of all 5 EPs!

i've cooked up some pretty juicy thank yous for you for enlisting in this army!  everything from a private Skype concert for you, where you pick the my set list, to signed, advanced copies of all 5 squadrons so you won't need to wait a full year to piece the story together, to having your name listed in the album's liner notes, to my performance of the cover of your choice, or even your own, specially commissioned original song. 

JAVIER RAMOS (cajon / hair)

KYLE MASTELLER (electric ... except he's on acoustic in that picture / muscle)

 

KEVIN PLYBON (acoustic / sarcasm)

DOUG BERNS (bass / faces)

... more band bios coming soon! 

 

you're so sweet to ask. we're going to get along just fine ;)

- SHARE my campaign video & a link to this page on Facebook, Twitter, your blog or shoot it over as an email to friends / family you think would love to join in.

copy & paste this as your status or tweet:

"I've #SetFireToSeparateLives and @kayte_grace is releasing 5 EPs to tell the story! Want in? Head to: igg.me/at/kaytegrace"

- JOIN THE PARTY by "liking" on Facebook, "following" on Twitter & opting in to get a once-a-month love note from me, straight to your inbox.

- INTRODUCE ME TO YOUR AWESOME CONTACTS got a great contact i should reach out to?  does your aunt anchor the morning news? does your old baby sitter review music now in the new york times?  do you blog for MTV? shoot me an email: kaytegracemusic@gmail.com ... we ARE my label! let's create some buzz :D

yay <3

 

thank you in advance for being so, stinking incredible.  i cannot wait for you to hear this music.
story_txt:
some pretty delicious things have happened since that fateful day 4 years ago, when months after just starting to teach myself guitar and have songs spill out, YouTube featured me on their homepage as the "Unsigned Pick of the Week" ...
 

3 albums ... press and interviews that still totally feel surreal ... tours where i figured out that i wanted coming to my show to feel like me having friends over in my living room.
and now, i've got new songs to share. want to check out my music?
watch the "Country Boy" Official Music Video
listen to the whole  "Written On" album for free! (feat. my cousin Victor Wooten on 2 tracks!)
hear my new single, "Join Forces"
watch a performance video from a show in NYC




i have a story to tell!  one that'll unfold in 5 parts ... little squadrons of a handful of songs each, marching into your heart, each chapter building into the next, every few months for the next year and a half or so.  


it's a story of love. and a relentless commitment to being together.




i'm raising $7,000 to record these 5 EPs in a NYC studio where i feel very much at home, where i know these songs will morph like transformers into music that truly sounds like living. the $7,000 will cover:


studio time


mixing & mastering the songs


printing & packaging CDs


paying a little something to my insane musicians who'll be trapped in a small room with me for countless hours

and finally, it'll give us a tiny promotion budget to spread the music to as many beautiful humans as we can








yep! once the songs are recorded & ready, one EP will be released every few months on a "pay what you'd like" basis! it's a new model for music.
it's like a dinner party - i LOVE cooking the food and can't wait for you to show up and just eat. but hey, if you want to help out by bringing dessert, i'd be super happy! ... i love dessert :) so when you download the songs, you'll be able to write in how much you'd like to pay - whether that's $0 if you're strapped for cash or $100 if you're feeling give-y!



*all perks $25 and over include a signed hard copy + digital downloads of all 5 EPs!
i've cooked up some pretty juicy thank yous for you for enlisting in this army!  everything from a private Skype concert for you, where you pick the my set list, to signed, advanced copies of all 5 squadrons so you won't need to wait a full year to piece the story together, to having your name listed in the album's liner notes, to my performance of the cover of your choice, or even your own, specially commissioned original song. 

JAVIER RAMOS (cajon / hair)

KYLE MASTELLER (electric ... except he's on acoustic in that picture / muscle)
 
KEVIN PLYBON (acoustic / sarcasm)

DOUG BERNS (bass / faces)

... more band bios coming soon! 












 
you're so sweet to ask. we're going to get along just fine ;)
- SHARE my campaign video & a link to this page on Facebook, Twitter, your blog or shoot it over as an email to friends / family you think would love to join in.
copy & paste this as your status or tweet:
"I've #SetFireToSeparateLives and @kayte_grace is releasing 5 EPs to tell the story! Want in? Head to: igg.me/at/kaytegrace"
- JOIN THE PARTY by "liking" on Facebook, "following" on Twitter & opting in to get a once-a-month love note from me, straight to your inbox.
- INTRODUCE ME TO YOUR AWESOME CONTACTS got a great contact i should reach out to?  does your aunt anchor the morning news? does your old baby sitter review music now in the new york times?  do you blog for MTV? shoot me an email: kaytegracemusic@gmail.com ... we ARE my label! let's create some buzz :D
yay <3
 
thank you in advance for being so, stinking incredible.  i cannot wait for you to hear this music.

story:
A little about me and this venture…

Writing songs for me has always been a way to work through and process emotions.  To me, music is medicine for the soul. It has healed me from pain and allowed me to feel in a way that other things just can't tap. It is a true universal language. No matter what race, creed, skin color, or societal status you are, when you hear music, you feel. Music over time has proved to be the one unifying element we have as a human race and world community. It can inspire, uplift, and penetrate people to ignite their light and life force. It cuts through all things, and with the right intention can create a profound and positive ripple in the world so we can together work towards prosperity, abundant growth, and well being for all.

My journey continues with the completion of this album in the hope of inspiring, uplifting, and healing the planet.  I want to create something people will be able to listen to, find some respite, and be moved as a whole.

How is it possible?

The band and I have been rehearsing for about a year and a half. We are ready to jump into the studio and record under the expertise of our Producer, Gaetano Lattanzi, whom I've been working with for the past 10 years on musical development. We need at least $20,000 to complete the album and release it with the necessary merchandise, social media, and radio campaign that will truly launch the record on a grand scale.

          Other ways you can help!

I completely understanding that some people may not be able to afford to contribute financially.  I know how difficult money troubles can make things!

If this is the case but you would still love to help it would be so appreciated if you could give this page a 'share' around your social networking site's! 

Indiegogo is hooked up with all the necessary 'sharing' links so it's quick and easy for you to help spread the word about this project! 

 Thank you so much for your support.  Every little bit will help.  What ever way you can give will be so greatly appreciated.  All the best to you and your creative journeys.  And stay bright out there and keep shining! 

---Elizabeth

story:
NEW ALBUM, TOUR, PERSONAL TRAINING and MORE!

The past couple years of my life have been really busy with As I Lay Dying tours, kids, and life in general. While I've always wanted to do a 3rd Austrian Death Machine record, it became harder and harder to justify the time. I have however found enough time and made it a priority to get in better shape. Maybe it's partly because of that, but for whatever reason, a huge percentage of fans started asking me for a new ADM record on the last couple tours.

I'm launching this campaign because I believe these are all things that you guys want  and if that's the case- it justifies leaving the rest of my life unorganized for a while when I focus on Austrian Death Machine.

Over the past year I've become increasingly interested in crowdfunding. It's a direct connection to fans and a way to offer unique and fun things... like training sessions or getting punched in the stomach that wouldn't exist otherwise.

Because crowdfunding is a way to provide creative and cool stuff that big business normally would be too afraid to invest in, I have another idea in mind to do a project on the more serious end of the spectrum eventually, as well. For now, I plan to get all my meathead humor out of the way.

Don't be a girly man and buy something fantastically brutal that will make both of our lives more full of pump! Plus, Arnie is back doing movies, so the timing is perfect!

If we can fund the record, I also want to do a Triple Brutal TerminaTour. But in order to do that, I'm going to need your clothes, your boots and your motorcycle- but more importantly, your support. Spread the pump so we can all get down! Ahhnold and I are willing to take this as far as the fans want us to!!!

story:
The Scoop

The Boys are a four-piece all-female Pop-Rock band from Hamilton, Ontario, and we believe we're the fresh knew talent that the music industry is looking for. We have some crazy big dreams and with your help we an achieve them. Chasing our dreams is what we want to do, but it comes with major financial committments, and four university students can't always handle it on their own. This is where YOU come in!

Where the Money Will Go

-Recording a full-length album

-Drum kit and monitors (our drum kit is broken in many ways)

-Touring across Canada/U.S.A

-Merchandise

-Chasing our dreams! Expensive band endeavours pop up everywhere.

The Impact

Our goal is to raise $5000 and if we reach that goal, $1000 will go to the Ontario Mental Health Foundation (http://www.omhf.on.ca/home/) to promote the mental health of people living in Ontario, to prevent mental illness and to improve diagnosis, treatment and rehabilitation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that's okay! Please forward this to your friends and family to help us meet our goals and to improve mental health awareness in Ontario!

story:
Listen to full length samples from our live performance under the Updates tab.

Taking its name from the medieval shorthand for "Gloria patri et filio," Euouae is a six-voice professional early music ensemble based in San Francisco. Read more about this project from artistic director Sven Edward Olbash:

World Premiere Recording The Requiem of 15th century composer Johannes Ockeghem is the earliest surviving musical setting of the Mass for the Dead. Euouae recently gave successful live performances of this work along with the Gregorian chants on which it's based. We have restored the earliest versions of these chants from the original 9th century manuscripts, which were unknown in Ockeghem's time and which remain largely inaccessible to modern performers of his work. Our forthcoming album will mark the first time Ockeghem's monumental composition has been recorded along with these restored chants.

The Next Step  I started Euouae as a self-funded project to explore new interpretations of ancient music. We presented performances during the 2010 and 2011 seasons of Old First Concerts. This year, I founded Lacuna Arts (a fiscally sponsored project of Fractured Atlas) to raise funds to provide fair compensation to our professional singers. Completing our debut album will help take us to the next level by creating additional performance opportunities in the coming season and beyond.

About the Artists  Having spent two years copying medieval manuscripts by hand with a fountain pen and developing new techniques for teaching this music to modern performers, I bring a unique insight to the world of early music. And I'm thrilled to be working with six virtuoso soloists who have performed with some of the best ensembles in the US, including American Bach Soloists, AVE, Philharmonia Chorale, Pacific Collegium, Schola SF, California Bach Society, Chalice Consort, and SF Renaissance Voices.

Budget With the help of our volunteers, we're able to keep overhead for this recording extremely low. That means 90% of our budget goes to providing fair wages for the musicians and recording engineers who are collaborating on this project:

  • $6,000 - musician fees for rehearsals and recording sessions
  • $2,000 - recording engineer, session fee and editing
  • $1,000 - CD duplication and set-up fee for downloads
  • $500 - administrative expenses

The End Result You've heard samples from our live performance in the above video. If we reach our goal, we'll be able to complete a fully professional CD and downloadable album, including music from this one-thousand-year-old manuscript.

story:
Who are the Funk Brothers: 

"The Funk Brothers was the nickname of Detroit, Michigan, session musicians who performed the backing to most Motown recordings from 1959 until the company moved to Los Angeles in 1972. They are considered one of the most successful groups of studio musicians in music history. The Funk Brothers played on Motown hits such as "My Girl", "I Heard It Through the Grapevine", "Baby Love", "Signed, Sealed, Delivered I'm Yours", "Papa Was a Rollin' Stone", "The Tears of a Clown", "Ain't No Mountain High Enough", and "(Love Is Like a) Heat Wave"". Wikipedia

The Funk Brothers performed on over  1001 hit records, more than the Beatles, the Rollling Stones, Elvis, and the Beach Boy's combined. 

Selected list of hit songs on which The Funk Brothers played

  • "Please Mr. Postman" - The Marvelettes
  • "Fingertips Pt. 2" - Stevie Wonder
  • "My Guy" - Mary Wells
  • "Where Did Our Love Go" - The Supremes
  • "Baby Love" - The Supremes
  • "Come See About Me" - The Supremes
  • "My Girl" The Temptations
  • "Stop! In the Name of Love" The Supremes
  • "Back in My Arms Again" The Supremes
  • "I Can't Help Myself (Sugar Pie Honey Bunch)" - The Four Tops
  • "I Hear a Symphony" - The Supremes
  • "You Can't Hurry Love" - The Supremes
  • "Reach Out I'll Be There" - The Four Tops
  • "You Keep Me Hangin' On" - The Supremes
  • "The Happening" - The Supremes
  • "Love Child" - Diana Ross and the Supremes
  • "I Heard It Through the Grapevine" - Marvin Gaye
  • "I Can't Get Next to You" - The Temptations
  • "Someday We'll Be Together" - Diana Ross and the Supremes
  • "Ain't No Mountain High Enough" - Diana Ross
  • "The Tears of a Clown" - Smokey Robinson and the Miracles
  • "Just My Imagination (Running Away with Me)" - The Temptations
  • "Papa Was a Rollin' Stone" - The Temptations
  • "Let's Get It On" - Marvin Gaye
  • "Midnight Train to Georgia" - Gladys Knight and the Pips
  • "Just a Little Misunderstanding" - The Contours
  • "Shop Around" - The Miracles
  • "Shotgun" - Junior Walker & the All Stars
  • "How Sweet it Is (To Be Loved by You)" - Marvin Gaye
  • "The One Who Really Loves You" - Mary Wells
  • "The Way You Do The Things You Do" - The Temptations
  • "Ain't Nothing Like the Real Thing" - Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell
  • "(I'm A) Road Runner" - Junior Walker & the All Stars
  • "Ain't too Proud to Beg" - The Temptations
  • "I Wish It Would Rain" - The Temptations
  • "Reflections" - Diana Ross & The Supremes
  • "(Love Is Like A) Heat Wave" - Martha & the Vandellas
  • "Hitch Hike" - Marvin Gaye
  • "What's So Good About Goodbye" - The Miracles
  • "I Was Made To Love Her" - Stevie Wonder
  • "It's The Same Old Song" - The Four Tops
  • "You've Really Got A Hold on Me" - The Miracles
  • "Standing In The Shadows Of Love" - The Four Tops
  • "If I Were Your Woman" - Gladys Knight and the Pips
  • "Going To A Go-Go" - The Miracles
  • "Heaven Must Have Sent You" - The Elgins
  • "Dancing In The Street" - Martha & The Vandellas
  • "Mercy Mercy Me (The Ecology)" - Marvin Gaye
  • "Cloud Nine" - The Temptations
  • "What's Goin' On" - Marvin Gaye
  • "Do You Love Me" - The Contours
  • "Get Ready" - The Temptations
  • "Function At The Junction" - Shorty Long
  • "My World Is Empty Without You" - The Supremes
  • "The Tracks Of My Tears" - The Miracles
  • "Can I Get A Witness" - Marvin Gaye
  • "Nowhere To Run" - Martha & the Vandellas
  • "Here Comes The Judge" - Shorty Long
  • "Signed, Sealed, Delivered (I'm Yours)" - Stevie Wonder
  • "Beachwood 4-5789" - The Marvelettes
  • "Bernadette" - The Four Tops
  • "Two Lovers" - Mary Wells
  • "What Becomes Of The Brokenhearted" - Jimmy Ruffin
  • "My Cherie Amour" - Stevie Wonder
  • "I Second That Emotion" - Smokey Robinson & the Miracles
  • "(I Know) I'm Losing You" - The Temptations
  • "First I Look At The Purse" - The Contours
  • "Ooo Baby Baby" - The Miracles
  • "25 Miles" - Edwin Starr
  • "I'll Be Doggone" - Marvin Gaye
  • "Pride and Joy" - Marvin Gaye
  • "Ball Of Confusion (That's What the World Is Today)" - The Temptations
  • "It Takes Two" - Marvin Gaye & Kim Weston
  • "This Old Heart Of Mine (Is Weak For You)" - The Isley Brothers
  • "Uptight" - Stevie Wonder
  • "Devil With A Blue Dress On" - Shorty Long
  • "Jimmy Mack" - Martha & the Vandellas
  • "Since I Lost My Baby" - The Temptations
  • "War" - Edwin Starr
  • "Stubborn Kind Of Fellow" - Marvin Gaye
  • "Don't Mess With Bill" - The Marvelettes
  • "You Beat Me To The Punch" Mary Wells
  • "Shake Me, Wake Me (When It's Over)" - The Four Tops
  • "Mickey's Monkey" - The Miracles
  • "Ain't That Peculiar" - Marvin Gaye
  • "Shoo-Be-Doo-Be-Doo-Da-Day" - Stevie Wonder

 

What We Need & What You Get

Many musicians that played in the Motown Era were not properly compensated for the work they accomplished. The Funk Brothers have not recieve adequate recognition for all of the hit songs they recorded.

We would like to raise funds to create awareness of all musicians that were apart of Motown before the early 70's. Our goal is that when you hear a Motown song, you think of the Funk Brothers.

We will create workshops that not only explain the history of the Motor City Sound, but also create mentorship programs, that will mentor kids through music. Funds will also aid recording sessions for new music that will be created by the Funk Brothers.

The Impact

By helping us out, you will help create history by educating the world on these  extraordinary talented musicians. Because of you we will be "Keeping the Funk Alive".

"You Beat Me To The Punch" Mary Wells
"Shake Me, Wake Me (When It's Over)" - The Four Tops
"Mickey's Monkey" - The Miracles
"Ain't That Peculiar" - Marvin Gaye
"Shoo-Be-Doo-Be-Doo-Da-Day" - Stevie Wonder

 


What We Need & What You Get
Many musicians that played in the Motown Era were not properly compensated for the work they accomplished. The Funk Brothers have not recieve adequate recognition for all of the hit songs they recorded.
We would like to raise funds to create awareness of all musicians that were apart of Motown before the early 70's. Our goal is that when you hear a Motown song, you think of the Funk Brothers.
We will create workshops that not only explain the history of the Motor City Sound, but also create mentorship programs, that will mentor kids through music. Funds will also aid recording sessions for new music that will be created by the Funk Brothers.


The Impact
By helping us out, you will help create history by educating the world on these  extraordinary talented musicians. Because of you we will be "Keeping the Funk Alive".

story:
Who is Mt. Thelonious?

Mt. Thelonious is a band born out of the minds of three young, working musicians with one goal in mind: to play the music they love. Ian Lubar, Alyssa Avery and Mark Wallace have come together to create a sound that honors the traditions of music's past and looks to blaze it's own trail into the future.

What We Need & What You Get

To reach our goal of producing a full length, mastered album and promoting it this summer on tour we need your help! By funding our project you are supporting local St. Louis musicians. We want to use our music to help revitalize the St. Louis music scene to it's former glory.

Your funding does not go unnoticed! Check out the side bar for the perks that come with your support.

story:
Send Polyrhythmics to Jazz Fest 2014!

In April 2014, Polyrhythmics will embark on a four week tour that culminates in New Orleans for a series of coveted shows during the 2014 Jazz & Heritage Festival. With your help we will be able to pay for the very high expenses of touring in new regions with eight musicians, two crew members, and bring the music you love to many more fans that are eagerly waiting to hear us!

For the past four years, Polyrhythmics has been hard at work recording original, afro-beat and polyrhythmic funk music. We have toured the West Coast and the Rocky Mountains, hired a terrific manager, booking agent, and purchased a road worthy Sprinter Van, all while developing our sound as we move the band toward being a National touring act. With the release of our brand new album “Libra Stripes” the word has spread and we have been able to land several highly anticipated performances at the 2014 New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival.

Playing our music in the city of New Orleans during "Jazzfest by Night" is a dream come true for us. This opportunity represents the single most important chance for us to turn on new fans from around the world and catapult our music onto the world stage. Unfortunately, driving from Seattle to New Orleans while performing in a dozen or more new places faces us with some very considerable expenses and risks. We plan on taking two and a half weeks to tour down to New Orleans and about ten days to play in a variety of situations in the Crescent City and surrounding area. This will be the first time the band has ever performed in the South, and because of this our connections in the area are very limited. We need to ask you for help in covering the expenses of this trip to help make this dream become a reality.  

The Good News:

The tour is booked, we bought a van to take us on our journey, (and many more to come) and the band members are willing to take the considerable financial risks that come from going out on a  long tour. We have locked down some very special shows in NOLA that will have us performing for hundreds (perhaps thousands!) of new fans, music industry insiders, and talent buyers from all over the world.

The Bad News:

We will not be making enough money from our performances on this tour to even scratch the surface of the expenses that we will incur, let alone pay the pro-talent musicians who make up the Polyrhythmics. To bridge this gap, we find need to pursue independent fund raising to make this dream come true and thats where we need you.

What the Money is Used for:

Expenses:

  • $2,500 in gas Seattle to New Orleans, LA and back again.
  • $2,000 in cheap motels for nights when where our connections for lodging run dry.
  • $4,000 for food. We travel with three 6 foot+ dudes, it gets quite pricey.
  • $600 for an oil change for "Jessica", our 12 passenger Sprinter van.
  • $1,000 to hire outside help in cities where we know no one to get us in newspapers, on radio, and to have flyers hung prior to our arrival.

We are calling on our fans, friends, family members and generous strangers to donate whatever they can to help Polyrhythmics make this trip to New Orleans as successful as possible. Every donation through Indie Go Go goes directly to the band, so you can be certain it will be safely and honestly used for the purpose of this tour. 

While we are trying to cover our enormous expenses of $10,000-- essentially asking you to donate generously, we do have some unique perks to give back in thanks, from a handmade Shekere by our percussion player Lalo, to hard to book private lessons with members of the band, we think you will find something that can make any donation a little more special.

Polyrhythmics has long known we are apart of the most unique, generous and savvy circle of music fans in the world, and from our soul to yours, Thank You!

story:
Hello
Social world music will be a software program that helps drive traffic to online streams and artists profiles whom are being played on them.
The biggest issue for radio play with indie artists is being able to be heard, or rather letting listeners, followers, or fans when and where they are being played.
With our software, when the artists song plays, it will post to their Twitter and Facebook, so the fan or follower can instantly click on the listen live link and hear the artists music that is being played on that particular station or podcast.
This will drive traffic to the radio stream/ podcast, and also traffic the the artists social media pages, and ultimately sales or downloads of their music

story:
Future album is 99% ready! Want to be the 1st who have it and put your name to credits? Take part in crowdfunding. 5 days left!





What You Get

This album will be released digitally. I’m really sorry for not being able of presenting lots of physical gifts as CD’s and other stuff…

But still you can get pretty cool perks for your funds! And don't forget, that by giving funds, you give birth to new music that you actually like. I guess, otherwise, you wouldn’t be reading this article. Maybe this is the most important gift?

5$ — Respect

  • My respect for you help
  • Your name inside artwork


10$ — Respect with music

  • My respect for you help
  • Your name inside artwork
  • You will be the first listener of new album (I will send you links)


15$ — Respect with all my music

  • My respect for you help
  • Your name inside artwork
  • You will be the first listener of new album (I will send you links)
  • Links to all Dreamstalker music in HD


30$ — Respect with all my music and PostCard from Bali

  • My respect for you help
  • Your name inside artwork
  • You will be the first listener of new album (I will send you links)
  • Links to all Dreamstalker music in HD
  • I will send you personal psychedelic paper postcard from Bali to any address! Awesome way to surprise your friend or just yourself.


60$ — Everything and more...

  • My respect for you help
  • Your name inside artwork
  • You will be the first listener of new album (I will send you links)
  • Links to all Dreamstalker music in HD
  • I will send you personal psychedelic paper postcard from Bali to any address
  • I can help you with your music if you are music maker. I can make really deep personal audit of your track. Cool thing for beginners! 


100$ — Your sound in my track

  • My respect for you help
  • Your name inside artwork
  • You will be the first listener of new album (I will send you links)
  • Links to all Dreamstalker music in HD
  • I will send you personal psychedelic paper postcard from Bali to any address
  • I can help you with your music if you are music maker. I can make really deep personal audit of your track. Cool thing for beginners!
  • I will make a track with any of your sound. Record on iPhone your snoring brother and after some months you will hear a track with this sound! Anybody here ready to play this game?


1000$ — is my minimum. If you give more, I shall be incredibly happy. Maybe I’ll have more time for my music. So, don't hesitate if there is already more than 1000$ :-)


Still in doubt?

It shall be the source of infinite joy for me to play music that would contain our collective energy! Dance music is all about sharing and exchanging our energy with each other. Make a decision if you want to be the one who supported birth of new music. I guess feeling yourself a part of today’s music culture shall bring you a lot of satisfaction and other pleasant sensations.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. So you can really help, getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign! Use share tools!

story:
Short Summary

I am a singer songwriter based in the San Francisco Bay Area; with an awesome and talented backing group called The Dudes, featuring Steve Witt (bass/mandolin) and Carlos Cajilig (lead guitar). You may know us from past performances at RAMA, Kearny Street Workshop, Hyphen Magazine, and other Asian American Arts organizations.  

My music is based in American roots music and my heroes include Bob Dylan, Johnny Cash, Ryan Adams, Jakob Dylan, and Bruce Springsteen.  I've been writing original songs and working on my craft for the past six years.  At recent performances, the audience response for these songs have been phenomenal.   With the great reception in mind, I am now very motivated produce a studio EP.

You may be aware of my Kickstarter campaign that did not reach it's goal.  So I am going the Indiegogo route.  The first you don't succeed, try try again. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $1000 to get started.  Majority of the funds will be towards music production. This means everything from booking studio time, recording the tracks, and to mixing and mastering. Any leftover funds will be used marketing purposes and putting the EP on iTunes.

Rewards include free download of the single "It's Alright" and free download of the finished EP.

The Impact

A professionally produced studio EP gives me a platform to further my music career.  I will have something tangible to give to an audience at shows or to use in booking gigs.  All in all, I get to share my music to the world.  It's not about the fame or the recognition for me, as corny as it sounds, it's for the music.  When I look back years from now, I could be proud of what I accomplished because music is everlasting.

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides donating, help spread the word, by sharing this page with your Facebook and Twitter feeds.  Even try to convince a friend or two to donate what they can.  

Feel free to provide them links to my demos on my bandcamp page, Soundcloud, and my Facebook page.

story:
Hello and thank you for visiting my campaign page.

My name is Briget Boyle. I am a singer-songwriter and I am working on releasing my debut solo album, The Parts Interior. This project is a long time coming and is very important to me!

I started writing songs when I was 14 years old and knew instantly that writing was my calling. Writing makes sense to me and makes me feel like I have a purpose. I went to the College of Santa Fe to study performance and composition and when I was there I wrote and wrote and was named the Songwriter of the Year in 2001. It was also there that I discovered Balkan music, which became a huge part of my life. I spent about 10 years singing Balkan music with Bay Area ensembles Kitka, Brass Menažeri and True Life Trio, all the while missing the songwriting I had put aside. Now, at 31, I am turning my focus back to myself as an artist. Through this campaign, you can help me realize my dream of releasing my first solo album.

So, what will I do with the funds?

1. A portion of your contribution will go toward hiring musicians to play on the fourteen original songs that I plan to record. It will feature members of Bay Area bands - True Life Trio, Iron Henry, and more. As I work with different collaborators, I will be sure to send campaign updates. 

2. The rest of the funds will go toward production of the album: studio rental, recording & mixing engineers, mastering, manufacturing, paying the producer, graphic design for the CD itself and web design.

What do you get in return?

Well, first and foremost: my undying gratitude and appreciation for believing in me and my music. 

After that there are many perks--CDs, downloads, baked goods, house concerts, producer credits, and more! Check em out. There is sure to be one for you!

Why support this project?

I believe that every artist needs to be heard or seen. Art is what keeps us thinking, keeps us learning, keeps us growing. I know that this process will be a huge learning experience for me and hopefully, through the process, you will learn a little more about who I am and what I have to say with my music. I hope that what I write can be healing for someone, as the process of creating is incredibly healing for me.

I have been involved in a few of these projects over the years. In 2012, True Life Trio, a vocal ensemble that I co-founded, successfully crowdfunded our debut EP, Home. The process was really great for us as a group. It helped us define our voice as a trio and connected us to our listeners in a way that we never imagined possible. When people have buy-in to a project, there is a fire behind it that is magic. I am looking forward to feeling that with this project. 

Please help me spread the word!

If you are unable to contribute at this time, please feel free to share this campaign. It will be most helpful to get as many people to hear about this as possible. Share it on Facebook, like my updates about the campaign, email it to people who might enjoy the kind of music I am putting out there. 

I really appreciate your support and cannot wait to share The Parts Interior with you!

story:
Paella World Tour - The Road Trip

Basically i'll be cooking paella in the most representative places of each city, I'll go by car on this road paella trip around the world so Every 100$ Means 100 Miles away from home, you decide how far i go!


Can you imagine a Paella in front of the Eiffel Tower, Big Ben or the Statue of Liberty!?

Let's do it! :)

Stretch Goals:

10$ I cook original paella valenciana at Valencia's beach.

5000$ Spain Paella Tour

10000$ Europe Paella Tour

25000$ Europe + USA Paella Tour

40000$ Europe + USA + South America

60000$ Europa + America + Asia

100000$ All around the globe paella Tour



    Risks & Challenges

    Risk is that the police catch me cooking in the city, but keep calm i'm paella chef :)

story:
Her Story

Brooklyn Mecca and Oyasound are the creative projects of Dj Sabine. Dj Sabine's events focuses on the exposure and pleasures of African Diasporic music. Oyasound music production label and Ep is currently in the works. Dj Sabine's mainstay and cultivation has been the monthly event Brooklyn Mecca which has been coined the home of "Grassroots Dance Culture". Dj Sabine spins Global Soul: House, Afrotech, Afrobeat, Haitian Roots and other diasporic tunes. Her main influences are her spirit guides, ancestors, and warrior women. Her ear for music soothes the innate part of herself and others that honors the sounds of drums, the power of words, and the healing affect of conjuring up pure positive feeling and emotion. She has had the great opportunity to spin nationally in the US in NYC, Atlanta, St. Louis, Memphis, Chicago, Omaha, Boston, Miami, LA/Oakland, NJ, Washington DC, Dallas, Denver and internationally in Montreal and Cancun.


The Impact

Dj Sabine's goal is to visit a new continent each year. This year it's Europe! She will share her interpretation of house & electronic music and gain inspiration from the sights & sounds of various countries. The intention is to globally connect with djs/producers, club owners/promoters, and dancers to create future Oyasound projects such as Eps, music workshops/conferences, and performances/events. Essentially, expanding the Global Soul sound and house music community.


What She Needs & What You Get

All it takes is 250 people to donate $20 each to reach her $5000 goal! This will cover airfare, transportation, lodging, meals, dj/promotional items. $50 or more will get you an exclusive Dj Sabine mix. $150 or more will get you an exclusive Dj Sabine mix & Brooklyn Mecca/Oyasound t-shirt. Any contribution is greatly appreciated and will certainly help Dj Sabine reach her Europe goal by the fall of this year!


Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise for the campaign! Share links on Facebook, Twitter, and personal websites/emails.


Merci! :)

What She Needs & What You Get
All it takes is 250 people to donate $20 each to reach her $5000 goal! This will cover airfare, transportation, lodging, meals, dj/promotional items. $50 or more will get you an exclusive Dj Sabine mix. $150 or more will get you an exclusive Dj Sabine mix & Brooklyn Mecca/Oyasound t-shirt. Any contribution is greatly appreciated and will certainly help Dj Sabine reach her Europe goal by the fall of this year! 


Other Ways You Can Help
Get the word out and make some noise for the campaign! Share links on Facebook, Twitter, and personal websites/emails.

Merci! :)

story:
Our Story

We are Diego's Umbrella-- an independent, San Francisco-based Gypsy Rock band that has been building a group of fiercely devoted fans since 2005. With 3 self-produced albums under our belt, and no distribution from any label, we take our music to the people the old fashioned way: relentless touring. And that suits us just fine, because we love to play live.

Our touring came to an abrupt halt in November, when our van, which we lovingly called, “The Plumber,” hit a patch of black-ice on the way home from a show in Tahoe. The van, with trailer attached, did a 180 across traffic and ended up in a ditch. We were all shaken, but thankfully no one was badly hurt. Sadly, the same could not be said for The Plumber. Our trusty van, which had become a home to us all, was totaled.

We haven't let it stop us, but the months since the accident have been challenging for us. We've had to travel to shows by caravaning in smaller cars, which has been extremely expensive in terms of gas, and stressful because not all of our cars are completely reliable. It also doesn't sit well with us to know that the caravan has increased the size of our eco-footprint.

Which brings us to our request: help us get back out on the road with a reliable van and trailer, so we can get back to doing what we do best.


The Impact

The best thing about being is Diego's Umbrella is that, every night, we get a chance to make people happy.  By the time we've hit our final song, we, and our audiences, usually end up an exhausted, ecstatic, beautiful mess.  It's an experience and an audience unlike any of us have ever had in other bands; we truly give our fans everything we've got and they give it right back.  We toured for nearly half of 2010, and our plan for 2011 was to take the touring even further; we are working on our first extended East-Coast tour in the Summer, and have even been batting around some Southern US dates.  Without a reliable vehicle for us to tour in, our plans and progress will definitely be slowed, and some touring may even have to be canceled.  And that is a genuinely heartbreaking thought for us.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

So that brings us to our specific goals, and how you can help! 


We are aiming for $12,000 total, which will be divided between $10,000 for a new van, and $2,000 for a trailer.  We will be looking for the best possible used van for the money, hopefully no older than 2002.  And the trailer will be a wonderful thing for us, because up to now we have always rented, which has been wasteful considering how much time we spend on the road.


But we're not just here for the taking!  Check out the list of amazing stuff we'll give you for making a contribution!!!



Please help us spread the word, folks! 

We need all the help you can give, so put this page up on your Facebook pages, tweet about us, anything you can, and once we're mobile we will do whatever we have to to COME TO YOUR TOWN!



THANK YOU!!!

Tyson Maulhardt

Vaughn Lindstrom

Ben Leon

Kevin Blair

Jason Kleinberg

Jake Wood

story:
After two years we are finally recording the 2nd volume to "Guitar Addiction - A Tribute To Modern Guitar" album and we need YOUR support ! The goal is to receive enough PRE-ORDERS to make it even bigger and promote all the great Artists who will play on it.

About Us

Over the past 8 years, we have grown to become a leading provider of services tailored specifically for the needs of an independent Guitarist/Musician. Our expertise in the music industry has allowed us to deliver the first "Guitar Addiction - A Tribute To Modern Guitar" Album in 2010. This awesome project was the result of a long and hard work that had make it possible to unit more than 60 of the most talented musicians of our time !!

Details of Vol. 1 on this mini website :

http://www.guitareuroshop.com/guitareuromedia/promo/guitar_addiction/

What we need for this 2nd volume

To put out our new record and promote all the participating Artists we need in totality more than 7000 €. That may sound like a lot but consider this: for a full length track album, depending on the song  it can cost up to 1000 € per track to record from start to finish (Studio time for mixing & final mastering included ). It will cost an additional one thousand euros to print and package. And to finish, publicity will have also a cost.

Risks and Challenges

With making an album, especially one with a number of busy guest musicians from several different countries involved, the logistics can be quite complicated, so the main risk is not getting the album out by the target date (end of December 2013). Having worked on many albums over the years we feel it is an achievable goal. We are also well known and trusted by many in the music industry so you can be sure that the final result will be very professional.

If we don't reach the funding goal we will still get the album out, but would have to make compromises on things like the artwork, publicity and some of the musicians.

If we exceed our goal we will be able to go a little bit further in our production wish-list, invest in more promotion so we can keep this project alive, and enhance the hard copy packaging so you will get more for your money!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can support the project by getting the word out and make some noise about the campaign:

  - Directing people to the Indiegogo page ( http://igg.me/at/guitar-addiction-2 )

  - Sharing the campaign video

  - Post a link to our campaign on your Facebook page

  - Post a link on your Twitter, and retweet our Twitter posts

  - Emailing your database

  - Telling music magazines / websites about it

  - You can also use the Indiegogo tools

 

We're confident that you're going to love this album, and discover extremely talented Artists. We can't wait to let it out !!

GuitarEuroShop & GuitarEuroMedia 

www.guitareuroshop.com

www.guitareuromedia.com 

 

 

(FOR THE PERKS THAT REQUIRE SHIPPING, IF YOU LIVE OUTSIDE EUROPE AND FORGOT TO ADD 6€ INTO YOUR CONTRIBUTION, PLEASE JUST MAKE A NO PERK CONTRIBUTION FOR THE PROPER SHIPPING AMOUNT.

 NOTE ABOUT SIZES:  FOR THE PERK THAT INCLUDE T-SHIRT, PLEASE WRITE YOUR SIZE NEXT TO YOUR NAME WHEN YOU ENTER IT.  IF YOU'VE ALREADY ORDERED AND FORGOT TO INCLUDE YOUR SIZE, WE WILL CONTACT YOU BY EMAIL.)

story:
Our Story

Hi,

We are Follow My Lead and we are a post hardcore / metalcore band from Ireland,
The computer that we currently use to record has broken and we're hoping to get funding for a new computer to get us back to recording and making music again.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of €2,500 to get our new computer but we're only actually looking to get €1,500 from this campaign and are willing to pay the rest ourselves with money we have saved.

What Funding Will Achive

The reason we are looking for funding is so that we can get back to making more content for you all to enjoy! Be it new band material or even new covers on youtube from the band. Feel free to check out some of our current stuff.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jvoDBa2GvuI

http://www.youtube.com/user/MatttFoxx/videos?view=0

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you can't contribute money and that's absolutely fine, We do however hope you share this link to help us raise awareness in the hopes to reach our goal!

Thank you all,
Yours,

Follow My Lead.

=<3=

story:
Short Summary

Direct from NYC, Global Block Collective, is an Internationally acclaimed artist/activist collective featuring husband and wife duo, US Hip Hop Ambassador George Rithm Martinez and Sylara.

In 2012 GBC toured throughout the Americas and headlined shows with Immortal Technique, Pharoahe Monch, Tom Morello, Pete Seeger, Jackson Browne, Redman and others. Now, Global Block is preparing to release their 2nd album, Occupation Freedom: Movement Music and need your push to do it.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $5,300 to fund our new album. That money will go to a variety of uses including: Renting equipment, studio time, mastering of the album, and CD duplication. We will also be employing the talents of an engineer and publicist.

Hoping to raise more to do more! Here are some additional funding targets and plans: If we raise:

$10,000 - We will sponsor a series of 5 public performances in Sandy Recovery Zones in NYC and develop a limited edition DVD of the experience.

$15,000+ - We will go on a regional tour (vehicle rental, etc... The more gas we can buy, the more communities we can visit. + develop a limited edition CD/DVD of the experience.

$25000+ - We will go on a national tour (vehicle rental, etc... The more gas we can buy the further we can go! + develop a limited edition CD/DVD of the experience. 

 

The Impact

For us, this album represents a labor of love that captures the spirit of hopefulness and empowerment embedded in Hip Hop culture and peoples movements everywhere. Thanks so much to all of those who have supported us in making this happen.  A huge thank you is in order for all of our fans who have motivated us to share our art with the world. A Donation of any size is greatly appreciated. Just knowing that there are people out there who enjoy our music is cause enough for us to celebrate.  

Please, if nothing else, come out to a show and support the movement! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and other social media!

THANK YOU!!

story:
I love music.

I grew up on AOR radio.  AOR stands for Album Oriented Rock, and that meant the station played more than just the hits. I discovered tons of terrific singers and bands thanks to those stations.

For example, back in 1984 (and into 1985), Bruce Springsteen’s “Born In The USA” album spawned seven singles.  Every one of those was a top ten hit.  My favorite songs off that album aren’t any of those seven, though.  They are “No Surrender”, “Bobby Jean” and “Workin’ On The Highway”.

I owned the record, of course.  Since it went 15 times platinum (platinum is a million sales), there’s a chance you did, too (or at least, someone you know owned it).  But I grew to really love those three songs from hearing them on the radio.

I still really like them, though I couldn’t even begin to guess when a radio station played them last.  For that matter, you don’t really hear those seven hit singles any more, either, at least not most of them.  “I’m On Fire” is suddenly getting a lot of airplay on a station here, so there’s a pretty good chance that a station near you is playing it all of a sudden, too.

A lot of stations these days “test” the music they play.  They do tests over the phone or in auditoriums, with a couple hundred people who fit the demo of their station.  This isn’t just a 2013 phenomenon; it’s been going on for years and years.  That’s why you can travel from town to town and coast to coast, and find stations that play almost the exact same music.

Of course, this doesn’t apply to every single station in America.  But it applies to a lot of them.  Too many.  They become afraid of playing a song that doesn’t test well, or they go the other way and get very excited about a song that does test well.  That’s how a song that you haven’t heard on the radio in thirty years can suddenly pop up often, even daily.  And that’s also why there’s a good chance that your favorite station has slipped “I’m On Fire” back into rotation.

Aside from all the music testing, there’s the multi-tasking issue.  In a lot of stations, the program director and the music director don’t just work for one station. They run several, what the corporations like to call a “cluster”.  So the guy programming your local rock station may also have similar tasks at their sister station, which is country, or adult contemporary.  Or all three.  Or even more.

I like lots of different kinds of music, but I don’t have a real passion for all of them.  And because of that, I don’t really know a lot about them.  So if I suddenly had to program a country station, I’d be in trouble.  Unless someone told me what I should be playing.

Someone who was also telling other country stations what they should play.  Or other adult contemporary stations.  Et cetera.

The other thing is that, for those stations whose employees do care about the music, the same protocols are in place.  Here’s a list of what your station is going to play.

I get that radio stations aren’t jukeboxes, but having someone who doesn’t care about the music deciding what music gets played, based on testing (and other nebulous factors) might give you a good idea about why stations sound the way they do.

That's why, to keep with Bruce Springsteen as an example, the majority of his music, going all the way back to 1973’s “Greetings From Asbury Park NJ”, gets ignored.  In fact, you’re more likely to hear Manfred Mann’s version of “Blinded By The Light” than Springsteen’s original version (because it tested well).

And other than a couple tracks off his Greatest Hits collection, you’re not likely to hear much from one of the hardest working guys in the history of rock.

Of course, Bruce isn't alone.

U2 got some decent airplay with 2001’s “All That You Can’t Leave Behind”, but twelve years later, there are only a handful of their songs that you still hear on the radio.  And most, if not all, of that can be found on their singles’ collection from 2006.  You just aren’t likely to hear anything more than the usual suspects from them.

Then there’s the Beatles.

John, Paul, George and Ringo had a lot of great songs, together and on their own.  In 2000, thirty years after they broke up, Capital Records released an album simply called “1”, which was a collection of their number one songs.  This went on to become the fastest-selling record in history.

If you’re lucky enough to have a station that still plays the Beatles, you’re lucky if you hear anything besides the songs on this album.

And as far as the solo stuff goes, some stations still play John’s “Imagine” and George’s “My Sweet Lord”.  You’ll probably get “Band On The Run” and “Live And Let Die” from Paul.  And your oldies station might throw on Ringo’s “Photograph” once in a great while.

It seems like a crime to me that all this music is getting lost.  And that radio has become such a wasteland that the people running it just seem to have absolutely no musical soul.

I used three easy examples here (Bruce, U2 and the Beatles) but there are so many more (and it’s growing every day).

And there are plenty of these artists who had terrific albums back then (whenever their “back then” was), and are still making music today!

Here’s a small sample of artists that have put out new stuff in just the last few months:

David Bowie
Bon Jovi
Eric Clapton
New Order
Adam Ant
They Might Be Giants
Depeche Mode
Big Country
Orchestral Manoeuvres In The Dark
Deep Purple
Justin Hayward
Poco
The Proclaimers
Todd Rundgren
Southside Johnny
Counting Crows

Also out this year, updated albums, remastered with bonus and/or live tracks from Huey Lewis, Fleetwood Mac, the Tubes, REM and the Allman Brothers!

And, previously unreleased live sets from ZZ Top, Head East, Rainbow and Crosby Stills Nash and Young!

Plus, new music coming from the Goo Goo Dolls in May and the Kinks’ Dave Davies in June!

And don’t forget that they finally put out a whole album full of previously unreleased music from Jimi Hendrix!

I don’t mean to suggest all these are equal.  While I still like “The Heart of the Night”, a new album from Poco doesn’t equal a new album from U2 (no offense intended to fans of either band).

I guess the thing is, I just get tired of turning on the radio in my car and hearing a lot of the same old, same old.  I can almost guarantee you that I will hear a Pink Floyd song and a Led Zeppelin song every time I go anywhere, even if it’s just a quick trip to the store.  And it’s also almost always one of the same few songs from either artist.

NeoClassic Rock looks to change that with a library of thousands of songs, with more being added all the time.  You'll hear your favorite songs and artists, with many that you probably haven't heard in a long time.  Plus, you'll get to hear brand new tracks from many of these same singers and bands, who are still releasing new stuff!

And as far as the solo stuff goes, some stations still play John’s “Imagine” and George’s “My Sweet Lord”.  You’ll probably get “Band On The Run” and “Live And Let Die” from Paul.  And your oldies station might throw on Ringo’s “Photograph” once in a great while.
It seems like a crime to me that all this music is getting lost.  And that radio has become such a wasteland that the people running it just seem to have absolutely no musical soul.
I used three easy examples here (Bruce, U2 and the Beatles) but there are so many more (and it’s growing every day).
And there are plenty of these artists who had terrific albums back then (whenever their “back then” was), and are still making music today!
Here’s a small sample of artists that have put out new stuff in just the last few months:
David Bowie Bon Jovi Eric Clapton New Order Adam Ant They Might Be Giants Depeche Mode Big Country Orchestral Manoeuvres In The Dark Deep Purple Justin Hayward Poco The Proclaimers Todd Rundgren Southside Johnny Counting Crows Also out this year, updated albums, remastered with bonus and/or live tracks from Huey Lewis, Fleetwood Mac, the Tubes, REM and the Allman Brothers! And, previously unreleased live sets from ZZ Top, Head East, Rainbow and Crosby Stills Nash and Young! Plus, new music coming from the Goo Goo Dolls in May and the Kinks’ Dave Davies in June! And don’t forget that they finally put out a whole album full of previously unreleased music from Jimi Hendrix!
I don’t mean to suggest all these are equal.  While I still like “The Heart of the Night”, a new album from Poco doesn’t equal a new album from U2 (no offense intended to fans of either band).
I guess the thing is, I just get tired of turning on the radio in my car and hearing a lot of the same old, same old.  I can almost guarantee you that I will hear a Pink Floyd song and a Led Zeppelin song every time I go anywhere, even if it’s just a quick trip to the store.  And it’s also almost always one of the same few songs from either artist.
NeoClassic Rock looks to change that with a library of thousands of songs, with more being added all the time.  You'll hear your favorite songs and artists, with many that you probably haven't heard in a long time.  Plus, you'll get to hear brand new tracks from many of these same singers and bands, who are still releasing new stuff!

story:
Achilles Wheel is a highly danceable Roots and World Music Rock and Roll band from Northern California. Right now we’re in the middle of making our new CD ‘Stones To Sand’. 

Producing and promoting ‘Stones To Sand’ is our group’s commitment to using our voice and music in a positive way. At the core of Achilles Wheel is the philosophy and the goal of bringing joy and connectivity to a fragmented world. Our more immediate goal, however, is to raise $16,000 to help pay for the recording, artwork, manufacturing and promotion of this CD, which will allow us to reach a growing audience as we travel ever further from home. 

The seemingly disparate backgrounds of the band’s five members is what creates a unique fusion of styles and musical influences. Award winning singer/songwriter, guitarist Paul Kamm, comes from the well known modern folk duo 'Paul Kamm and Eleanore MacDonald’, while lead guitarist and songwriter Jonny Mojo performed for years with the popular ‘Sacramento Blues Review’. Mark McCartney, on drums, has had a colorful career playing with many bands including Shanna Morrison, while AW’s other drummer, Gary Campus, can point to working with internationally renowned Scottish Fiddler Alasdair Fraser as one of his many musical lives. Shelby Snow on bass guitar has worked with some of the finest California bands and has shared the stage with the likes of Carlos Santana, John Cippolina and Steve Kimock. All of this pours out of an Achilles Wheel show like fresh water on a hot day. 

 Achilles Wheel was formed roughly three years ago and we released our first CD, ‘13 Hours’, shortly after that. ‘13 Hours’ was recorded live at the historic Nevada Theater in Nevada City, California with the echoes of Mark Twain and Lola Montez bouncing around in the rafters. There we put together a raw and live feeling CD that reflected well the celebratory nature of our music and since then we’ve been lucky enough to have played at some of the biggest music festivals in California, including Strawberry and Kate Wolf. Which brings us to today… 

The 14 songs on this upcoming CD have been a regular part of our live shows for long enough now that we knew it was high time to finally get them recorded, and we’re asking you to help make that goal a reality by donating to Achilles Wheel through Indiegogo. 

Check out the rest of our Indiegogo page to learn how you can help fund this project, and to see what we’d like to offer you in return. 

And finally, we want to send out a big thanks to all of you who continue to come to our live shows and support our music. Help us get ‘Stones To Sand’ on its way by donating what you can, and by sharing Achilles Wheel with others. Whether it’s a little, or a lot, we will appreciate it all equally and put it to good use. Thanks very much from Achilles Wheel and we’ll see you all on up the road.  

* Please note:  delivery of perks is not guaranteed for July 1st, but it will be our best effort and intention to do so...thanks!!

As we hit the end of our campaign we'd also like to thank the good folks who came directly to our door with money for this project.  In the two days we have left we'd like to encourage you to give us a chance to complete this journey by donating through Indiegogo, or if you are a rebel and want to send a check directly, please do.  Just look us up at www.achilleswheel.com

thanks and peace

AW
