story:
The Gist

Hi everyone! So here's what we're trying to do. This campaign is a pre-sale for our upcoming album "Alright, Here We Go..." We plan to print up CDs and Vinyl LPs of the album and your pre-purchase of the album can help make that happen!

What We Need & What You Get

Every part of the album making process is complete except for the pressing. We've already recorded (Steve Boaz/Rob Derrick @ Breathing Rhythm Studio), mixed (Steve Boaz @ Breathing Rhythm Studio), and mastered (Garrett Haines @ TreeLady Studios) the songs and the artwork is complete thanks to Erin Margaret Allison Rambo and Galadriel Thompson. Now we want to put some copies in your hand! So here's the breakdown:

We want to print 500 12inch vinyl LPs and 1000 CDs and once we have them printed we'll throw some big album release parties. We also want to do some promotion for the album. All of this will run us about $6000. 

In addition to pre-release digital copies of the album, we're offering some other cool perks including cigar box guitars, house concerts and liner note shout outs. Find the perk that speaks to you and be a part of the project!

Your Impact

I consider myself very lucky to get to make music I love with musicians I love and perform for people who love it too. We are all part of a creative community that is truly amazing. By contributing to this campaign you're helping to ensure the future of that creative community that allows us to create music. And with this album out, we'll be playing more shows in more towns! We're starting to do more regional travel and having an album like this on the road makes all the difference in the world. So if you'd like to see this band grow and help us do so, get on board!

Other Ways You Can Help

Let your friends know about this campaign! Share the link on your social media pages, mention it to your co-workers at the water cooler on Monday, send an email to a friend, every little bit helps. Indiegogo has some easy to use share tools so help us get the word out! Thanks a million! 

Sincerely and humbly,

-Kyle Reid & the Low Swinging Chariots

story:
Dear friends, it's been breathtaking to witness your enthusiastic support! Our gratitude is endless! This campaign has  been an amazing experience thanks to all of you! Your generosity is what makes us certain that we're on our way to reach our goal! Please keep on supporting our video! Keep on clicking the "contribute now" button and donate! Anything makes a difference. We absolutely mean it! The smallest contribution counts! Share the campaign via email,  Facebook, Twitter and any kind of social media! Only with your help we can make it happen!


About 6 months ago i started my solo project Isolator,it took a lot of courage from just having the idea to actually start doing it and i'm using every little piece of time and energy to make it going.
it's a lot of work writing the music, program the music, record all the drum parts and mixing it, some songs are done, some are still in the making and now it's time to make my first music video for the song "cold sweat". i'm very excited about it and scared at the same time, i have everything planned and ready to go with a HUGE help from my good friend Jo Jo Hristova and my brother Adam Halfi only thing that's left is to fund it.
making a music video isn't cheap so if you think you can help with a small donation(every penny counts) check out the link below or share it with your friends to show support and to spread the word.
thank you all! with your help i can make it happen!!!

story:
About This Project

A singer since emerging from the womb, Leigh Jones started writing her own music after receiving a ukulele as a Christmas gift in 2009. Since then, she has been building a name for herself in NYC's independent music scene, and has toured around playing prestigious venues on both coasts of the US. She released her debut EP "Bare Bones," in April 2011 to an overwhelmingly positive response. Her folk-leaning music has been described as whimsical, unpredictable, and emotionally stirring, and her voice as earnest and sweet, yet powerfully dynamic.


In February 2012, Leigh will go into the studio to record her first full-length album, entitled "Worth Wild." Leigh has become known for her lyrically driven tunes, and while a few of the songs on the album will remain true to the stripped down style of "Bare Bones," Leigh plans to enliven many others by incorporating a wide range of instruments. And this will take time. And as reluctant as we may be to admit it, in many a situation, time equals (dun dun duuuuuun)......money.

 

The fundraising goal has been set at $3500, which will roughly cover the recording time in the studio and the printing of the physical CDs. Any funds raised beyond that will go toward mixing and mastering, promotion of the album, and feeding and transporting all the incredible musicians that will be on the album!


In return for your support, you will receive different "perks" (outlined in the column to the right), and the chance to be involved in a truly grassroots artistic campaign. The independent musician cannot survive without his or her fans, those who believe in and support the music at its very core, and the rewards are a way to try to express the extent of the gratitude that is felt for your generous support. 


With "Worth Wild," Leigh will have a fresh, new, high quality product to share with fans at live shows, and to spread to various online outlets and industry professionals. Feel free to spread the word about this project to friends, via email, facebook, singing telegram, or what have you, and if you feel moved to do so, donate today!


Check out some of Leigh's music and info about upcoming shows at www.leighjonesmusic.net


Stay tuned for updates on the fundraising and album-making process, and to see who else is involved in the project! If you have questions or comments about the campaign, make a post under the "Comments" tab, or drop Leigh a line at leighjones11@gmail.com


Thanks for tuning in!

story:
My Goal

After two years of being asked by fans if I have a CD, the time has finally come: My Goal is to record and complete my Debut CD, "Be a Light" by August 31st, 2011, and I'm asking all who feel inspired to partner with me and my amazing band on this soulful journey by donating to this project and helping us spread the word.

My Story

Two things have been true for me my whole life: I love to sing and I love to share my love with all who cross my path.  Being raised in a musical family, singing became a natural language for me to express myself and all of my feelings at a young age--one of my favorite things to do beginning around the age of 6 was to spend hours recording myself singing my favorite songs until I got them "just right." As I grew up, I discovered another love--nurturing and supporting others in discovering their joy.  After completing a B.A. in Psychology, I attended a Life Coach Training Program and began my coaching practice, Ignite Your Voice Coaching in 2006--I help people feel worthy to celebrate who they are and share themselves fully in the world.


I began writing my own music in 2008 after asking myself one of my favorite coaching questions: "If you could attempt one thing knowing that you could not fail, what would it be?" The answer for me was clear: I would be a singer/songwriter, and spread my message of love and empowerment through my music.  I had so many doubts around my ability to actually live that dream.  I had this belief that despite being a musician my entire life, that it was OTHER people who could play guitar and write songs, not me.  But I strive to live my life with courage and authenticity, so I knew that it was time to start putting one foot in front of the other and pursue my dream. 


Now, 3 years later, I am ready to record my first album and send my love out into the world more fully.  I will be joined in this project by my talented lead guitar player, Joe Harris, my dear friend and mandolin player, Nate Gauger, percussionist and beautiful soul, Pete Calgaro, my talented cousin, Jake, on bass and vocals, and the engineering and prducation staff at Paradyme Productions.  I get goosebumps just thinking about it!

Why Donate?

I have worked tirelessly over the past four years spending all of my resources to build my coaching practice and support others in achieving fulfillment, give keynote addresses on cultivating joy in our lives, and step out more boldly as a singer/songwriter in sharing this positive message.  Without your support, I will do all that I can to get my music out there, but it will take me MUCH LONGER (as in MAYBE some time next year?) to complete my debut CD.  By donating now, you are fueling up my engine so that I can get this CD out before summer's end--At a time when the world needs this positive message perhaps more than ever.


My message can best be summed up by lyrics from the song that I wrote for my godchildren called "Beautiful Child":

"Little Child, sometimes you'll feel as if your heart is wrong, and sometimes you'll feel as if you don't belong; but Little Child, if you listen to the voice that's deep inside, you will see that all you have to do is shine."

and lyrics from my song, "It's Alright"

"...And the truth is, we're all trying to be good, and all of us just want to be understood.  When we seek the truth through another's eyes, we realize that we are all the same."

or my song "Be Here Now":

"The moment before me is all that I need, the fear and the sadness my guide.  The more that I open to all that I see, the more I see it all, dissolve into love."

In this time of great political and financial unrest, both at home and abroad, it can be hard to know where to begin when trying to effect positive change.  No matter where we might stand politically or spiritually with regard to these issues, I think that we can all agree that it is more crucial than ever that we send messages of love, hope and gratitude out into the world, and by donating to my album project, that is what you are helping me to do. 

Budget Breakdown:

In order to make this album happen, we need $5000 (my goal on this site is $4300 thanks to generous donations over the past few months)


$3500 will go to recording, mixing, mastering, and hiring additional musicians through Paradyme Productions in Madison, WI.


$1500 will go toward creating and duplicating CD's (in a quality case with lyrics sheet, so you can take in all of the juicy lyrics. :)


If I do not reach my goal, as mentioned above, I will still complete this project, it will just take MUCH LONGER for me to make it happen--any money toward this project will hang out in my savings account and solely be used toward making this album and sharing my music with the world.


If I surpass my financial goal: YIPEE!!! :) Any extra money that I might raise through this campaign will go toward the purchasing of a P.A. system for me and my band.


See the donation levels on the right of this page to explore all of the super-awesome rewards you will receive when you donate! :)  (Hint: If you want one of the bigger rewards, like a house concert for example, you can pool resources together with friends and make one donation!)

Other Ways You Can Help

HELP ME SPREAD THE WORD!!!! Crowd-funding sites like IndieGoGo only work when LOTS of people team up to get the word out and LOTS of people see the page.  If you believe in me, my music, and my message, please use the social networking and email tools above to tell everyone you know about this project. 


With Much Love and Gratitude,


:)Melissa

:)Melissa

story:
Jean Morisson INSPIRATIONS: "Out Here On My Own"

Beauty in the Breakdown

I'm here to tell you a little about me and the musical journey that I've been on. I've been making music my whole life- it is everything to me. As the lead singer of MorissonPoe, an Electro-Rock band I was lucky to be able to create a lot of music and grow a really great following, tour the country. We had songs featured in video games and a video that was not only on MTV, but it made the list of nominees for Video of the Year - I'm still kinda in awe about that. ;)

"Beauty In The Breakdown" is my solo debut album, that takes you through the ups and downs of my past few years...it tells a story...some sexy... some heartbreaking....Life.

With these songs, I've been incredibly fortunate to have the opportunity of music-making with some of the most talented musical minds on the planet, including the one and only Nile Rodgers (CHIC, Madonna, David Bowie), Vernon Reid (Living Color), Raymond Angry (The Roots, Joss Stone), amazing engineer Jason Goldstein (Beyoncé, Lonely Island), Grammy nominated Ian Schreier, the legendary Bob Clearmountain, and many more.

This alone has been a dream come true but for me, my dream is only complete if I can share it with everyone. It takes a lot more than working these greatly talented musicians to release an album - it also takes money, and not wanting to deal with anymore crooks, I need your help!

As a show of my gratitude for all your support, I have come up with a list of "goodies" I hope you’ll love. The complete list is located on the right hand side of this page.

That's it! That's me. Thank you for believing in me, supporting my dreams, and helping to fund my album.

Love Always,

Jean M.

 

 

About MorissonPoe

MorissonPoe released two nationally distributed albums. The EP "Glitter Girl: of The Tale, The Passion and The Rapture" released on MorissonPoe's own label Chemical, and "Evolution," released by Nile Rodgers' label, Sumthing Else Musicworks. "Glitter Girl *Evil Side*" was featured in-game and on the soundtrack for X-Box 360 launch title, Perfect Dark Zero. Also included in-game and on the soundtrack was the bands sultry-pop "Pearl Necklace."

MorissonPoe "Glitter Girl: of The Tale, The Passion and The Rapture" EP

MorissonPoe "Evolution" Album


The Sessions So Far

Mixing with the legendary Bob Clearmountain at Mix This!

Bob Clearmountain, creating the magic.

Raymond Angry (The Roots, Joss Stone) and I, right after he tracked some amazing B3 on one of my songs.

Mr. Nile Rodgers tracking on one of my songs at Avatar (The Power Station)

Vernon Reid tracking guitars at Electric Lady Studios for a song on "Beauty in the Breakdown"

Listening back to some rough takes at Avatar (The Power Station)

Vernon Reid and Nile Rodgers getting ready for amazingness at Avatar (The Power Station)

Vernon Reid, me and Nile Rodgers after tracking at Avatar (The Power Station)

More, More, More

MorissonPoe "Glitter Girl" premiering on MTV's Jumbotron in Times Square NYC

Live with Vernon Reid in Vegas

Thank you everyone!

 

MorissonPoe "Glitter Girl" on MTV from the Perfect Dark Zero soundtrack
story_txt:
Jean Morisson INSPIRATIONS: "Out Here On My Own"
Beauty in the Breakdown
I'm here to tell you a little about me and the musical journey that I've been on. I've been making music my whole life- it is everything to me. As the lead singer of MorissonPoe, an Electro-Rock band I was lucky to be able to create a lot of music and grow a really great following, tour the country. We had songs featured in video games and a video that was not only on MTV, but it made the list of nominees for Video of the Year - I'm still kinda in awe about that. ;)
"Beauty In The Breakdown" is my solo debut album, that takes you through the ups and downs of my past few years...it tells a story...some sexy... some heartbreaking....Life.
With these songs, I've been incredibly fortunate to have the opportunity of music-making with some of the most talented musical minds on the planet, including the one and only Nile Rodgers (CHIC, Madonna, David Bowie), Vernon Reid (Living Color), Raymond Angry (The Roots, Joss Stone), amazing engineer Jason Goldstein (Beyoncé, Lonely Island), Grammy nominated Ian Schreier, the legendary Bob Clearmountain, and many more.
This alone has been a dream come true but for me, my dream is only complete if I can share it with everyone. It takes a lot more than working these greatly talented musicians to release an album - it also takes money, and not wanting to deal with anymore crooks, I need your help!
As a show of my gratitude for all your support, I have come up with a list of "goodies" I hope you’ll love. The complete list is located on the right hand side of this page.
That's it! That's me. Thank you for believing in me, supporting my dreams, and helping to fund my album.
Love Always,
Jean M.

story:
Here's the deal...

Our two goals as a band are 1. To have fun and 2. To not suck. We're trying to accomplish BOTH with this campaign! Here's what we're looking to fund...

  • Mixing/Mastering for all 6 songs on the EP
  • Pressing 100 limited-edition CDs + some free goodies like stickers
  • BEER. We want to have fun.

They told us to keep it professional... We meant books.

This IS actually super important to us...

Each member of our band LOVES music. We live and breathe new bands, and get pretty stoked about playing live (to an alarming level). From playing weekend tours to turning up after practice, we feel as if we've lived Forward Smash's second run to it's fullest... Almost.

  • We want our EP to sound AMAZING. Not just "oh I mean... like... it's cool that you're on a CD" good, but "OH MY GOSH MARRY ME" good.
  • We're working with two different producers, Mott Cameron (Clementine, 20+ years of experience) has been tracking our new songs in his home studio and they sound GREAT. Brandon Cagle (Whitechapel, Empire, almost tall enough to ride rollercoasters) took our self-tracked old songs and made them into something you can listen to without wanting to die.
  • If we can raise this money, we will have accomplished almost every single thing on our bucket lists with regards to being in a band. 3/4ths of the band are graduating and we'd love to make this EP something that we'll all look back on with pride.

What you get

"I don't really care about your band; I just went here because Brian's feet are broken and I feel bad..." WELL WE HAVE PRIZES IN STORE FOR YOU.

  • There are rewards at every level of the budget!! This is also our way of letting you pre-order our EP (still unnamed) and party.
  • You'll feel like a champ for supporting a local band who needs money to do cool things
  • Here's some of our music that you can listen to for free now: forwardsmash.bandcamp.com/track/b-is-for-biddie

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're also broke, it's okay. You can share this online, tell friends, or steal money from someone... please don't do that last one.

  • We'd love it if you could share on facebook, instagram, myspace, friendster, or AOL online
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Hashtag #forwardsmash #tourwardsmash or #turndownfornothing to spread the word

If you've read all the way down to here, you're a real champ and a winner. We love you with our whole hearts (Dalton's is alarmingly large for some reason), and hope you can find a way to help!


-Forward Smash (Mark, Nate, Dalton, Brian, and sometimes James)

story:
Our Story

MusAid is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that helps music schools in developing countries with donated instruments and volunteer music teachers.

Since our founding in 2007 we have helped music schools in Kyrgyzstan, Laos, Burma, Haiti, Afghanistan and most recently in El Salvador.  Please visit MusAid.org 

Scroll through some of the pictures from our last workshop in El Salvador


About El Salvador

In August of 2013 MusAid began a partnership with the government of El Salvador and their "El Sistema" national orchestral program. El Sistema offers free music lessons to children and youth across the country and gives them an opportunity to play together in local orchestras.

El Sistema was initiated in 2011 in an effort to prevent at-risk children from joining the notoriously dangerous gangs of the country.  

El Salvador is considered an epicenter of the gang crisis in Latin America. Along with gang related crimes, the country experiences very high rates of juvenile delinquency.

El Sistema offers an alternative to gang life and fosters community development through ensemble playing.

MusAid Teaching Workshop

After discussing the needs of the various music schools across the country, MusAid sent six highly qualified musicians to conduct a week long music workshop for both students and teachers.  Being a new program, the students and teachers needed help with pedagogy and instrument fundamentals.  

The workshop helped the students and teachers with instrument playing fundamentals, and provided them with knowledge that could continue to be used long after the workshop ended.  We finished the week with a fantastic public concert that showcased the student's hard work.

The workshop was a huge success and we have been asked to return to continue to aid the newly founded El Sistema program.

Please visit Susanna's colorful blog entry about her experience teaching viola during our El Salvador workshop HERE

We need your help!

MusAid plans to return to El Salvador in May 2014 with seven MusAid fellows to continue working with the students and teachers of El Sistema, however in order to make this possible we need your help!

In order to make our trip possible we need to raise $10,000 to pay for travel costs, room & board and donated instrument transport expenses.

All Donations are Tax-Deductible in the USA and Canada.

Even the smallest amount will help the children of El Salvador tremendously!

Your contribution to the El Sistema project may help save the lives of children in El Salvador by steering them away from gang life and into the world of music.  

Please encourage your friends, family and colleagues to donate by sharing the link to this project.  

You can also donate on behalf of someone else and we will send them the respective perks. A great Christmas Gift!

Thank you for your support!


You can also take a look at our Project Haiti Video Below

story:
THANKS FOR MAKING IT TO MY CAMPAIGN ! !  Its over now but feel free to see what it is :-)  also you can follow me on Facebook
or on Twitter or on Instagram or my Bandcamp until then, have a wonderful day ! :-)

-----------------------------------------CAMPAIGN------------------------------------------------------

I ONLY HAVE A FEW HOURS LEFT TO GET AS CLOSE TO MY GOAL AS POSSIBLE ! ! PLEASE Help me make my birthday wish come true!!

My name is Lara Anderson, I was born right in the heart of the all so fabulous, Hollywood California. (Wilcox and Selma to be exact).
I have been creating, singing and dancing from a really young age.
Music IS and has always been part of me, and as I grew with it, came the dancing and other "wild" ideas I create to go along with it.

I will always remember the time, I was about 8 years old, and I was singing and performing one of my favorite songs (to myself) in the sink/bathroom area. This is where all the girls in the 2 connecting dorms would go to freshen up and brush our teeth before getting ready for bed. Somewhere in my drifting mind, I had made all the tooth brushes and hygiene products all on the sink, my audience, and I was performing to the world. I imagined I was on a mountain with a big stage at the top, and everybody (the tooth paste and tooth brushes) in the audience were so happy I was finally performing for them. I was near the end of the song, (not to mention) really passionate and totally into my life time performance to the world, only to be distracted by 8 faces in the door way watching me when I looked in the big mirror in front of me. I turned real quick! Slightly embarrassed and caught red handed with my wood paddle brush clenched in my hand, I paused and looked at them. I was just waiting to hear the laughter and silly things they were about to spray out of their mouths, but instead, they yelled "Keep going!" with so much joy! ... I was embarrassed about my perfectly set up show in front of me on the sink, and the fact that we only had 5 minutes till bed time, that I didn't finish the song, but, I went to bed that night knowing exactly what I was intended to do for the rest of my life.
Now, here I am years later.

As most artist and business people know, money/finances is a very key thing in this world right now, to have to help achieve the end result in a creative idea or project. Not every project or artistic idea, but most. This album, is that for me.

I have amazing producers and artists that I have worked with and that I am currently working with, that need to be compensated for their wonderful support in creating the detailed structure for this new album. As well I need money for the technical side of getting the album completely done. This includes each of the 10 songs on this album getting produced, mixed and mastered, paying editors and cinematographers for at least 3 music videos... and so on. This takes time, energy and equipment to be done the right way. I need to get the album created, designed and physically made so I can get it to you and the rest of the world ! :-)

Here are a few fun perks that I have to offer you for your support ! Its not a lot, but, its worth it, and the real gift is the the feeling you will have when you help me to create something so magical and awesome! Not only will you be making my birthday wish for February 2014 come true but my life dream!! And you will also be helping me make it available for  whoever else wants to have it because it will be complete :-)

LARA - You Got Me Now   ... Is a video I did at this time last year, with only a handful of awesome supportive friends and artist !!

Here is a video I JUST released, again with a handful of artists friends and A LOT of work!!  Can You Feel Me - LARA FM ft. KANGA

Imagine what I could do WITH a proper budget!!

PLEASE SUPPORT!
$1,000 donation is absolutely not the limit, and I will come up with something extra special if you donate even more!!

THANK YOU FOREVER!!    

Sincerely, LARA

story:
Audio Snippets of DEATHDRIVE




'Death Drive' is a collision of two very distinct worlds; the scorched earth of indie rap legend, Sole, and the concrete jungles of certified platinum producer, DJ Pain1. 'Death Drive' combines modern pop/rap aesthetics with the political edge reminiscent of hip-hop classics such as “Fear Of A Black Planet". Sole & DJ Pain1 utilize the golden era hip-hop approach of a rapper and DJ without employing gimmicks or rap cliches typical with more formulaic two-turntables-and-a-mic unions. Cross-pollination between mainstream music and the underground has been happening for years, but anything that bubbles up is always devoid of substance. Death Drive is a political rap album executed in a way that eschews the rapper persona of savior/prophet and speaks from the riot line. In a period of human history where critical music is absent from the airwaves, this is true resistance music. 

(Overseas orders please add shipping costs per item)

Sole: In 1998 he founded Anticon Records, the first collectively owned indie Hip-Hop label in the United States. Since then, Sole has played over a thousand shows throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, the Middle East and Japan. Recently, Sole pulled his masters from anticon and has re-invented himself as a new kind of artist, business, and political entity. His music has been featured in major media outlets such as Rolling Stone, 2DopeBoyz, Pitchfork, MTV, Huffington Post, Spin, Alarm Press, Alternet and many more. Sole has released ten full length studio albums and over a dozen mixtapes. Throughout his career sole has been known as one to push the limits in terms of genre and content and is widely heralded as a pioneer of avant garde & experimental rap music. This year, Sole & his wife Yasamin released the instrumental project WHITENOISE and Sole launched "The Solecast", a podcast featuring long form interviews with academics, artists and activists . Sole’s activism reaches beyond the studio and stage into his everyday life where he is deeply involved material and logistical support to many projects that engage directly in the class struggle. 


“Sole is an Indie hip hop legend.” - The Huffington Post
"Sole is a true revolutionary." - Pitchfork
"Cult indie-rap icon" - Spin
“Sole is controversial and experimental…the Crass of the hip-hop world” - Diffuser.fm

DJ Pain 1: Known for his 2008 break-out beat on "Don't Do It" for Young Jeezy's platinum-selling album "The Recession", producer DJ Pain 1 stays busy. He tours as a DJ, produces full albums, as well as creating original and free content for the producer community - this Hip-Hop musician takes no breaks. Pain 1 spent the late 90's cultivating his hip-hop sensibilities through graffiti, DJing and beatmaking. He juggled a youth service/teaching career with creating music, often times marrying the two worlds-- he co-founded the first hip-hop performing arts program to be hosted in an institute of higher education in his city. Once Pain 1 decided to focus on his production career, his resume quickly grew to include both legendary hip-hop acts (Public Enemy, Kool G Rap, MC Lyte) as well as contemporary hit-makers (Juicy J, 2 Chainz, 50 Cent). He has also garnered attention for his multiple Youtube video series on both production technique and music business know-how.


"[T]he next truth in sonic production." - Chuck D of Public Enemy
"DJ Pain 1 has done a lot for Madison’s hip-hop rep and a lot for others period, either as a beatsmith for Young Jeezy and Kool G Rap or as an educator working in the community." - The AV Club
"DJ Pain 1 provides the cure for the common beat." - 77Square Magazine

Rewards?

Explanation of Rewards:

  • Everyone who contributes gets a copy of the album regardless of dollar amount!

  • DEATHDRIVE Card game is a 560 piece card game, based on the rules of "Apples to Apples" but with an anti-capitalist/ Death Drive bent, that is both humorous and intellectually stimulating.

  • DEATHDRIVE Lyric Tapestry, similar to the "Lyric Prayer Flags" that came with ARCOEE, the Lyric Tapestry is an art object with all the lyrics from the album; gold ink on black fabric.

  • DEATHDRIVE T-Shirt, Gold Ink on a black shirt.

  • DEATHDRIVE "Producer Kit" is a sample collection put together by DJ Pain 1 with all the stems, samples and acapellas used to make DEATHDRIVE.

  • DEATH chain: Beautifully constructed DEATHCHAINS, very limited.

  • Lyric Sheets: These are pages from sole's notebook from the Deep Puddle/Bottle of Humans/ Selling Live Water/ Live From Rome era.   (Sole stopped using paper shortly thereafter)

Budget?

What we are fundraising for:

  • The funds from this fundraiser will go towards Mixing, Mastering, Video Production, Manufacturing, Publicity, Tour Support and Marketing. 
  • This release is testing out new DIY methods of releasing & distributing music overseas and in North America.  
  • This music has the power to empower, educate, intervene & bump in the club, and must be heard outside of the radical niches that Sole & Pain inhabit.

      break-out beat on "Don't Do It" for Young Jeezy's
      platinum-selling album "The Recession", producer DJ Pain 1 stays
      busy. He tours as a DJ, produces full albums, as well
      as creating original and free content for the producer
      community - this Hip-Hop musician takes no breaks. Pain 1 spent the late 90's
      cultivating his hip-hop sensibilities through graffiti, DJing and
      beatmaking. He juggled a youth service/teaching career with
      creating music, often times marrying the two worlds-- he
      co-founded the first hip-hop performing arts program to be hosted
      in an institute of higher education in his city. Once Pain 1
      decided to focus on his production career, his resume quickly grew
      to include both legendary hip-hop acts (Public Enemy, Kool G Rap, MC Lyte) as well as contemporary hit-makers
      (Juicy J, 2 Chainz, 50 Cent). He has also garnered attention for
      his multiple Youtube video series on both production technique and music business know-how.  "[T]he next truth in sonic production." - Chuck D of
          Public Enemy"DJ Pain 1 has done a lot for Madison’s hip-hop rep and a
          lot for others period, either as a beatsmith for Young Jeezy
          and Kool G Rap or as an educator working in the community." -
          The AV Club"DJ Pain 1 provides the cure for the common beat." -
          77Square Magazine
Rewards?Explanation of Rewards:
Everyone who contributes gets a copy of the album regardless of dollar amount!
DEATHDRIVE Card game is a 560 piece card game, based on the rules of "Apples to Apples" but with an anti-capitalist/ Death Drive bent, that is both humorous and intellectually stimulating.
DEATHDRIVE Lyric Tapestry, similar to the "Lyric Prayer Flags" that came with ARCOEE, the Lyric Tapestry is an art object with all the lyrics from the album; gold ink on black fabric. 
DEATHDRIVE T-Shirt, Gold Ink on a black shirt.
DEATHDRIVE "Producer Kit" is a sample collection put together by DJ Pain 1 with all the stems, samples and acapellas used to make DEATHDRIVE.

DEATH chain: Beautifully constructed DEATHCHAINS, very limited.

Lyric Sheets: These are pages from sole's notebook from the Deep Puddle/Bottle of Humans/ Selling Live Water/ Live From Rome era.   (Sole stopped using paper shortly thereafter)

Budget?What we are fundraising for:
The funds from this fundraiser will go towards Mixing, Mastering, Video Production, Manufacturing, Publicity, Tour Support and Marketing.  

This release is testing out new DIY methods of releasing & distributing music overseas and in North America.   

This music has the power to empower, educate, intervene & bump in the club, and must be heard outside of the radical niches that Sole & Pain inhabit.

story:
Who We Are - A Bit of Background

Yes, these boys can sing!

Capella Regalis Men and Boys Choir was founded in Halifax, Nova Scotia, by Director Nick Halley in 2010 and is modeled on the great Anglican tradition of men and boys church choirs.  While Canada was once rich with such choirs, Capella Regalis is one of only a handful of men and boys choirs in Canada today.  The choir is a free programme open to any boy who passes an audition. Transportation is provided to and from rehearsals twice each week, and the choir funds, through donations and grants, a summer choir camp and other musically- and socially-enriching outings and experiences. 

The choir sings Choral Evensong every Tuesday of the academic term in the University of King’s College Chapel in Halifax.  The choir also performs concerts throughout Nova Scotia and beyond in a busy September – June season.  Past concerts include Bach’s St. Matthew Passion with the University of King’s College Chapel Choir, Carmina Burana with the Nova Scotia Youth Orchestra and the King’s Chorus, the Paul Winter Consort’s Missa Gaia/Earth Mass with the King’s Chorus, the recent production of Benjamin Britten’s Saint Nicolas with the King’s Chorus, annual spring tour programmes of favorite sacred and secular repertoire, and the popular annual Christmas concert, To Bethlehem with King’s.

The journey to adulthood for boys is a challenge that has garnered the interest of researchers, educators, philanthropists, and social critics over the last few decades.  A men and boys choir, with its built-in system of mentorship, is uniquely capable of addressing the issues of leadership, focus, and inspiration that so many boys face at this stage in their lives.  Then of course there is the result of this experience: access to some of the most incredible music mankind has had to offer over the last eight centuries.  Through Evensong services, the boys learn and perform a fresh slate of this music every week.

Capella Regalis is a registered Society under the Societies Act of Nova Scotia and is an educational outreach programme of Musique Royale.  For more information, please visit www.capellaregalis.com

About our Director

Director Nick Halley works with four choirs in Halifax, Nova Scotia, two of which he founded.  Nick's desire to start a liturgically-based boys choir in Halifax was based on his own musical experiences in a good children's choir during his formative years.  In 2012, Nick was awarded the Queen Elizabeth II Diamond Jubilee Medal in recognition of his contribution to Canada and Nova Scotia through the arts, particularly for his work with Capella Regalis Men and Boys Choir.  In September of 2013, Nick became the new Host of CBC’s Choral Concert, a national, weekly radio show exploring all facets of choral music.  Nick is a jazz drummer and world percussionist who performs and records internationally with a wide range of musicians.  You can learn more about Nick at www.nickhalley.com

Our Project: What We Need & What You Get

We need a CD!  We would like to make a short recording (4-5 tracks) of the men and boys that we can send to music presenters and use in our recruiting, publicity, and fundraising efforts. 

We need $6,000 CAD to audio record, produce, and manufacture a batch of 100 CDs with basic packaging.  Although we have a lot of repertoire that we could record at this point, we are narrowing it down to two brief recording sessions and 4-5 tracks to make this initial recording project financially feasible.  Our budget also includes funds to video-record one of the sessions in the hopes of having some audio-visual content for our website and YouTube.  We have the recording engineer booked, the singers and accompanist booked, the rehearsals have started... we just need some funding!

What will you get for contributing to a high-quality recording of an excellent men and boys choir?  For a donation of $10.00 and up, you get a hand-written thank-you card from us acknowledging your contribution.  For a donation of $100 or more, you will get your own, personal copy of the CD as soon as it comes out.  

If we do not reach our goal of $6,000 CAD, we will still put all funds received toward a recording of some length - we may not do the video recording, and we will limit the number of tracks recorded and the number of CDs manufactured based on the funding we get.  



 Other Ways You Can Help

We would love it if you could help spread the word about our choir and our campaign.  You can copy our campaign link and put it in an email to anyone you think might be interested in what we do.  Indiegogo has great share tools!


Photos by Jesse Blackwood, Vanessa Halley, Kathy MacCulloch, and Sarah Stevenson.

story:
Hey Everyone,

My name is Kelly Vaughn. As a lot of you know, I've been singing and playing in the DFW area for many years now in a couple different bands but I've finally been given the opportunity to do something different and long lasting.

If you've seen my campaign video above, you know why hitting this goal is important to me. I am currently working with a great team of people who are creating my CD artwork, mixing and mastering my music, planning out music videos, helping to book live performances and more. This is a huge step for my music career on a national scale.

This campaign is a way for you guys to be a part of what is happening/about the happen and receive some exclusive goodies, merchandise, behind the scenes access and a whole lot more before we officially launch. There's something here for everyone and I am grateful for everything you contribute! 

This new project is the beginning of something fun, creative and impactful. With your help I hope to change the lives of those around me through my testimony and the new songs I have written.

 Thank you in advance for all your support! 


More Details: 

So to break it down in more detail,

This $2500 funding goal is for the exclusive purpose of creating the first batch of the physical CD units, the costs of mastering, our initial distribution to iTunes and some basic travel costs to and from radio stations. By contributing to this campaign you allow all of this to happen, get some rewards no one else will get, and be the first to hear me on the radio! 

The perks outlined to the right are designed to give you something cool and special no matter what tier you choose to contribute from. 

The Impact

There is always risk in promoting music no matter your age, genre or funding behind you. But with the major backing I will have once this campaign is completed, I know I will be able to impact and influence the lives of those around me in a positive and uplifting way. 

Those of you who have supported me in the past have seen my track record. This time around we are kicking it up a notch and making some real waves in the industry


Other Ways You Can Help

One of the most important things about this next phase of my life is to get the word out about this campaign and the project I am currently working on! If you cannot contribute to this campaign, I ask that you please share it with friends who may find it interesting.

Your support is much appreciated. Thank you all and I look forward to seeing you at my future shows!

Kelly Vaughn

story:
Short Summary


Ayetoro is an Afrobeat collective directed by Funsho Ogundipe. Founded in 1996 with a track record of creating an identifiable sound expressed in releasing 5 albums touring in Africa and Europe and is a unique global collective with formations in London, Accra and Lagos. Our sound is based on jazz and our heroes include Sun Ra and the Arkestra, Fela Kuti and Miles Davis. This album is seven years in the making and was recorded in London, Accra, Lagos and Capetown and features Collaborations with Afrobeat Legend Tony Allen, Songstress Nneka, Violin Player Kyla rose Smith and a host of talented musicians. Each tune has an accompanying concept video which will be released online. 



What We Need & What You Get


  • We need to raise 10000 Gbp. This will cover the costs of producing the new album. We aim to produce Cds,Vinyl and Dvd copies of the new album as well as marketing costs involved in promoting the album.
  • Breakdown.
  • Vinyl 2000Gbp 1000 copies
  • Cds  1000 Gbp 1000 copies
  • Dvds 1500Gbp 2000 copies
  • Travel2000Gbp
  • PR    3500

For our friends we have vinyl 50  12 inch double albums of our last international release Omo Obokun : The Afrobeat chronicles vol 2

We also have 7 special tee shirts momentos of our web only album Asoju Oba.

They are special rarities and will go on a first come first serve to contributors of 

250Gbp and above. The albums will be autographed. All contributors will get 

get the new album in all formats along with special freebies to be anounced as we go on.

We have every confidence we will be able to raise the funds we need because we will also be ready to put our money where our mouth is. Even if we dont raise everything here we are confident we will be able to underwrite some costs and release our album.

With your support we will be able to definitely make a big splash and further promote our music and get it out there to a bigger audience.

story: Ok, plain and simple.....I am in the middle of recording the first album I've written since 2006. After the end of the band BLESSEDBETHYNAME, I thought I was done with creating music as an artist....WRONG. With an entirely new life setting and circumstances conducive to art....I have composed an entire acoustic album of absolutely unbelievable songs with the assistance of Erika Ness. I booked recording time at Villain Recording with Byron Filson  and ALMOST completed the album. We tracked all but 1 and half songs, pre-edited 5 out of 11 and ran out of time and money. So, I'm reaching out to people that support my music, like my music, want to hear more of my music and of course to friends that just "have a shitload of money." It would mean the world to me to get this assistance and YOU WILL NOT BE DISSAPPOINTED in the album. I'm at a different place in my life, sober, wiser and more creative than I have ever been. These songs reflect that. Please help me out and there will a piece of  you all within this album. Thank you so much. You ROCK!!!!

story:
NEWLY ADDED VIDEO!



So what's all this then?

Hi! I'm Rick Hromadka. Singer-songwriter and frontman for the Los Angeles band's Maple Mars (psychedelic pop rock) and Ruby Free (70's AM pop rock). One would think that would be enough to keep me busy. But alas, I've gone off and done what many music frontmen have done for generations - recorded a solo album!

I'm seeking funding for mastering and duplication of my first solo album entitled "Trippin' Dinosaurs".

Your help will make what I think is a super cool album even better!

You want us to pay for your album?

Not exactly. I've already spent the past year writing, recording, producing, and mixing the record in my own studio, as well as paying for time in others. The $3000 I'm looking to raise will give this record the final polish only a good mastering engineer can provide. The rest of the money will then go to duplication costs so I can get a physical CD out to the public. Anything I take in over that amount will go towards radio promotion, and possibly some vinyl prints. Think of your pledge as a pre-order of the album!

The perks I've created for your pledges range from collectable iron-ons to digital downloads and CDs of "Trippin' Dinosaurs", to CDs from my other bands Maple Mars and Ruby Free, dinner and drinks, and even a private house concert. Cool right?

If my goal is not reached I'm fully prepare to put my house on the market and pull my kid's college funds. Thanks for that! Seriously, no matter what happens with the campaign the show will go on. And every contributor will get what's promised.

Ok, so you sort of have my attention. Tell me more.

A year in the making, this solo "pet" project has been handled with care. Channeling some of my DIY heroes like Paul McCartney, Todd Rundgren, and even Prince, I play every instrument on this album - including drums. I took my time building this dinosaur from the ground up. First tracking drums, then bass, then keys, guitars, and whatever else I could get my hands on, and finally vocals. Much of the album was improvised as I began recording.

My last release in 2012 "Introducing Ruby Free" received great reviews and was in regular rotation on about 50 college radio stations across the country. I ended signing a song placement deal with 5 Alarm Music/Rescue Records for TV and film. Maple Mars has had similar success, and my side business of writing music cues has landed me placements on shows like True Blood, Friday Night Lights, ER, Thirdwatch, as well as Reality TV programs like The Great Race, Dog The Bounty Hunter, and Say Yes To The Dress. Hell, I even wrote songs for The Power Rangers TV show and feature film way back in the day!

Gosh, this all sounds dandy! Where can I find out more?

Please check out the Gallery at the top of the page to view my videos!

Visit these pages to learn more!

Maple Mars Official Website

Maple Mars Facebook Page

My Twitter Page

Ruby Free Facebook Page

My IMDB Page

Will this album bring world peace?

Probably not. But it can bring a little joy to your life if you like the psychedelic sounds of the Beatles, Pink Floyd, Flaming Lips, or anything late 60's early 70's for that matter! Please make a pledge now for Trippin' Dinosaurs!

story:
Park Jam is a participant-driven art, music and dance event that brings together people of all ages to celebrate our great city and each other.  For 9 summers on the first Sunday of the month, we have built community with a positive vibe that is so, well- Long Beach.  Since 2003, we have relied on volunteers and community members to donate their own DJ equipment to put on the event. 2013 is Park Jam’s 10 year anniversary.  It is time for Park Jam to have its own equipment.  And, we need your help to keep the event you love going strong! 

Park Jam seeks to improve the vitality of Long Beach by: 1) building stronger community cohesiveness through art, performance and music; 2) celebrate the highly diverse traditions of Long Beach; 3) build social capital between diverse groups; 3) empower youth through meaningful participation and leadership opportunities and; 4) create a forum that welcomes participation and collaboration in a non-restrictive format.

Park Jam’s welcomes over 500  participants monthly.  Each month the entertainment differs based on what attendees bring to share.  This variation keeps our event relevant.  The music line up is made up of volunteer DJ’s who play  a variety of genres of music including reggae, hip hop, techno, Latin, Motown hits and experimental track.  A dance floor with people of all ages ensues.  Each event also features a dance or musical performance that reflects our city’s diverse cultural traditions. Past performers include LA Influence (a Long Beach salsa dancing team), African dancers from the Homeland Cultural Center, Capoeira dancers, Sirena Serpentina fire dancers and others.

Creating a space for artistic expression is an important goal of the event. Local artists share their talents by displaying their art well as creating live works during the event.  Volunteers bring hands-on activities for youth and participatory arts projects for adults.  Our event is also a forum for ideas; political and environmental activists and local hopeful elected officials attend to connect with potential constituencies.  Park Jam also integrates a variety of onetime special events that respond to the interests and needs of our community.  Past special events include youth talent shows, water fights, relay races, yoga, fashion shows, organized sports, films and  a bicycle contest by team Epic.  One regular attendee, Matthew Ota, brings his large telescope to share his love for astronomy with Park Jammers.   

 

 What We Need

Music is the answer! Park Jam needs its own equipment to keep the music going!!! We can no longer impose on our friends by borrowing (and damaging, yes this did happen) their expensive gear!  This equipment will belong to Park Jam, for years to come!

 

  1. Rane TTM57 Mixer for DJ  ($1999.00)- new retail
  2. Folding tables: ( Quantity  5  x $39.99 each)=  $200
  3. Canopy to provide shade for DJ =($200.00)
  4. 7500 Watt Generator to power DJ station=  ($1000.00)

 =$3400 TOTAL

 

The Impact

Your donation will allow Park Jam to thrive this summer and for many more to come!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, we still need your support.

Ways to help:

  1. Share the Park Jam campaign with a friend
  2. Give back to the event you love through volunteering:

Volunteer opportunities include:

-      Facilitate activities for youth

-      Clean-up crew

-      Raffle crew

-      Donate art supplies

-      Help Park Jam go green 



Who Organizes Park Jam?

Park Jam is organized by Collective I.  We are an all-volunteer group of Long Beach residents. Through unity, love and creation, we are committed to the promotion of local and conscious artists, the maintenance of a viable creative community and the fostering of positive social change through these efforts.  Collective I’s goal is to unite Long Beach’s community through art and music while embracing and celebrating our rich diversity and its many cultural traditions. 

Please go to our Facebook page to learn more about Park Jam:

https://www.facebook.com/CollectiveI?fref=ts
story_txt:
Park Jam is a participant-driven art, music and dance event that brings together people of all ages to celebrate our great city and each other.  For 9 summers on the first Sunday of the month, we have built community with a positive vibe that is so, well- Long Beach.  Since 2003, we have relied on volunteers and community members to donate their own DJ equipment to put on the event. 2013 is Park Jam’s 10 year anniversary.  It is time for Park Jam to have its own equipment.  And, we need your help to keep the event you love going strong! 
Park Jam seeks to improve the vitality of Long Beach by: 1) building stronger community cohesiveness through art, performance and music; 2) celebrate the highly diverse traditions of Long Beach; 3) build social capital between diverse groups; 3) empower youth through meaningful participation and leadership opportunities and; 4) create a forum that welcomes participation and collaboration in a non-restrictive format.
Park Jam’s welcomes over 500  participants monthly.  Each month the entertainment differs based on what attendees bring to share.  This variation keeps our event relevant.  The music line up is made up of volunteer DJ’s who play  a variety of genres of music including reggae, hip hop, techno, Latin, Motown hits and experimental track.  A dance floor with people of all ages ensues.  Each event also features a dance or musical performance that reflects our city’s diverse cultural traditions. Past performers include LA Influence (a Long Beach salsa dancing team), African dancers from the Homeland Cultural Center, Capoeira dancers, Sirena Serpentina fire dancers and others.
Creating a space for artistic expression is an important goal of the event. Local artists share their talents by displaying their art well as creating live works during the event.  Volunteers bring hands-on activities for youth and participatory arts projects for adults.  Our event is also a forum for ideas; political and environmental activists and local hopeful elected officials attend to connect with potential constituencies.  Park Jam also integrates a variety of onetime special events that respond to the interests and needs of our community.  Past special events include youth talent shows, water fights, relay races, yoga, fashion shows, organized sports, films and  a bicycle contest by team Epic.  One regular attendee, Matthew Ota, brings his large telescope to share his love for astronomy with Park Jammers.   
 
 What We Need
Music is the answer! Park Jam needs its own equipment to keep the music going!!! We can no longer impose on our friends by borrowing (and damaging, yes this did happen) their expensive gear!  This equipment will belong to Park Jam, for years to come!
 

Rane TTM57 Mixer for DJ  ($1999.00)- new retail
Folding tables: ( Quantity  5  x $39.99 each)=  $200
Canopy to provide shade for DJ =($200.00)
7500 Watt Generator to power DJ station=  ($1000.00)
 =$3400 TOTAL
 
The Impact
Your donation will allow Park Jam to thrive this summer and for many more to come!
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t contribute, we still need your support.
Ways to help:

Share the Park Jam campaign with a friend
Give back to the event you love through volunteering:
Volunteer opportunities include:
-      Facilitate activities for youth
-      Clean-up crew
-      Raffle crew
-      Donate art supplies
-      Help Park Jam go green 

Who Organizes Park Jam?
Park Jam is organized by Collective I.  We are an all-volunteer group of Long Beach residents. Through unity, love and creation, we are committed to the promotion of local and conscious artists, the maintenance of a viable creative community and the fostering of positive social change through these efforts.  Collective I’s goal is to unite Long Beach’s community through art and music while embracing and celebrating our rich diversity and its many cultural traditions. 
Please go to our Facebook page to learn more about Park Jam:
https://www.facebook.com/CollectiveI?fref=ts

story:
The Gaza Music School is the Edward Said National Conservatory of Music branch in Gaza. It was founded by the A.M Qattan Foundation in 2008,with the academic and technical support of the ESNCM, in response to the growing demand for music education as a means to facilitate the access of Gaza people to cultural life. More importantly, the GMS came as a vital intervention filling a gap in the mental health services in the Gaza Strip that was diagnosed by several local and international actors in the field; the need for mental relaxation programs such as music education to help Gaza children recover from the brutal psychological impact of the Israeli wars against Gaza. The GMS utilizes the healing capacity of music to contribute to improving the psychosocial wellbeing of the children of Gaza and the community at large. The school contributes to encountering the davastating effects of the recurrent traumas of the Israeli wars and assaults and of the socioeconomic problems and isolation aggravated by Israeli's prolonged occupation and blockade of Gaza over the past two decades. Thus, the School represents a pioneering innovative intervention utilizing and promoting music education as a means of psychosocial reconstruction and introducing the latter as an integral part of the wider multidisciplinary processes of post-war reconstruction of the Gaza Strip. The school offers the first-ever structured and long-term music education program in Gaza opening opportunities children (186 students are currently enrolled; 85% are females), aged 6-18, to learn the joy of music, and share it with their community.

The GMS pioneering experience and recognized impact locally and intentionally on the lives of the children of Gaza and the society at large, contributes to placing psychosocial reconstruction through music education in the agenda of local and international development actors. It emphasizes the need of the population of Gaza, who have been experiencing multiple traumas in the past decade in addition to the effects of two decades of siege, to more than political and economic reconstruction to the wider post-war reconstruction procsses of the Gaza Strip. It also provides an opportunity for the Gaza population and children in particular to enjoy their basic right, enshrined by the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights and the UN Convention on the Rights of the child, to participate in cultural life. Through music, the GMS has indeed succeeded in utilizing the healing capacity of culture to contribute to improving the psychosocial wellbeing of Gaza children and youth and promoting a culture of freedom, creativity, diversity and steadfastness among them and the society at large.

The overall objective of the project is to empower Gaza children to claim and enjoy their rights as a means to nurture the creative potentials of young generations and to flourish the creative diversity that can sustain public life in Gaza. It contributes to achieving the following objectives:

- Promote artistic freedom of expression and cultural rights as an integral part of basic human rights and freedoms enshrined by international human rights conventions;

- Position cultural rights and development in the development agenda of local and international actors;

- Improve the psycho-social wellbeing of children and the society at large and thus foster social cohesion and sustain public life;

Contribute to facilitating the access of traumatized community under siege to cultural life and artistic productions;

story:
Short Summary

Music and performance is everything to me. I taught myself piano, guitar, ukulele. I act and dance. But most of all I am a singer. Some kids are dedicated to ski racing. Some to soccer. Some to riding horses. For me its voice. I sing regularly in school ensembles, participate in the spring Musicals and various music festivals. I sing in the shower. I sing in the car. I sing to my little sisters. I sing with friends and I sing with professional trainers. One of my teachers graciously nominated me for the Carnegie Honors Choir Performance Series program last spring. The nomination was accepted, I applied, auditioned and was accepted to participate and perform at Carnegie Hall with other dedicated peers from all over the country in February of 2014!!! 

What We Need & What You Get

Of course nothing of this nature is free. The tuition for the program is $1600, which includes housing and training but does not include travel to and from NYC, food or other miscellaneous expenses. I am already helping to pay for vocal training, piano and dance lessons out of the money I earn working at a local cafe, and babysitting. At the same time, I am also applying to colleges which requires travelling to visit each school, application fees and travelling back again to each to audition. Needless to say my parents and I are tapped out of any extra money for such a program. We are hoping to raise enough money to cover tuition and perhaps a bit more for my travelling costs to the Big Apple.

The Impact

I am incredibly dedicated to my passion and work very hard in school, at work and on the stage. To be able to work with such a high caliber group of instructors and like-minded peers and then to cap it all off by performing on the stage of Carnegie Hall would be beyond enriching and inspiring - it would be an actual dream come true. To hear one of my vocal groups and a post-performance interview of me on WCAX channel 9 click on this link: 

liza on WCAX  

If you watch it through to the end and listen to my answers to the interviewer's questions I think it will be clear to you how much this experience would mean to me :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily to my campaign I genuinely thank you for taking the time to investigate my site and would very much appreciate you helping to spread the word and pass this along!

Love Love Love

story:
Hello and Welcome!

     I am launching a very special project in my life!  By the beginning of next Summer, I hope to begin production on my debut album/cd I have been writing songs for the past several years.  My songs tell a story about discovering real life, real people, real pain, and a real God who meets us in these places with a promise of hope.  I want people to know our pain doesn’t equal who God created us to be.  His love is greater than our pain and so is His plan for life.  I hope these songs allow you the opportunity to spend a few moments with Him.  God cares about your struggles!  He has created me with the purpose of sharing His love and faithful presence to a hurting world through music.

     My goal is to create a quality recording that shares a life changing message that points to a way forward with God’s help and a greater sense of freedom.  The recording fees are between $8,000 – 10,000.  I will be making this album here in Sugar Land at Edgewater Studios (www.edgewater-studios.com) with Derek Hames producing and John Shelton engineering. I have had people approach me saying, “how can I help?”  If you feel a desire to be a part of this ministry goal, you can make a donation on this site.  I promise to partner with you by keeping you in the loop with updates on how this recording project is progressing.  Maybe you have a story to tell of how God has helped you through a trial and new hope was found.  Please share your story here!  I would love to hear it and share it with others.

     Click on the Sound Cloud link below to hear some of my songs.  Together we can make a difference in a hurting world and see many lives transformed.  Thank you in advance for your prayers and support in the months ahead! 

                                                    Sharing a message of hope, 
                                                                Kathy Baker

story:
We are excited to announce that we are preparing to record our debut EP and we need your help. We have been developing brand new material over the past 6 months and with your support we can bring this incredible project to life. The EP will be recorded at the VMG studios in South Austin (Jess & The Echoes, Candiland, Vallejo, Dirty Wormz, Kendall Beard) Produced by A.J. Vallejo.
     We look forward to sharing this project with all of you who have been supporting us from day one. Your donations will help cover the cost of recording, mastering and printing the EP for release in 2014. Please come on board and join us for this amazing musical journey. We really do need each and every one of you because every donation counts as we try to meet our goal. You will also get super cool rewards in exchange for your generosity.

story:
Short Summary

Dear friends,

We are musician duo Feather & Folly, made up of Júlía Hermannsdóttir from Reykjavík, Iceland and Holly Overton from Nags Head, North Carolina, respectively. We met and started working together in 2007 while studying art at Parsons in New York City.

We are working on realizing our dream of making a cassette tape + digital release of our most recent and only studio recordings, collectively titled Miss You Sister, and we are going to commemorate the release by getting together in Reykjavík, Iceland, for the first time ever, to play a series of free, off-venue shows for Iceland Airwaves festival 2013. You can listen to the songs from the tape on our bandcamp page: http://featherandfolly.bandcamp.com/

We would be incredibly grateful if you could help us supplement the costs of studio time, tape production and travel by buying our tapes, digital downloads of our songs and / or postcards hand-drawn by us (the above drawing / tape cover artwork was drawn by Júlía Hermannsdóttir, and here you can view some beautiful postcard drawings by Holly Overton.) You can even buy a collection of our older, home made recordings if you are feeling particularly generous!

The Miss You Sister recordings were made in fall 2010 shortly before we were separated by the Atlantic Ocean when Júlía unexpectedly had to move home to deal with a serious chronic illness. This is partly why the release has been a long time coming and why it is particularly precious to us to get the recordings out into the world and play together once again!


What We Need & What You Get

Ideally we would like to raise $1000;

$300 to supplement studio cost

$200 to supplement the production of 100 tapes

and $500 to supplement travel costs.

You can help us towards the goal by buying one of our perks listed on the right. All perks include world-wide shipping!

...Note that even if we don't reach that goal you will still get what you paid for and we will still receive the funds raised. However little we raise will be incredibly helpful to us! 

And if you don't have the means to support us but would still like to help, you could help us out by sharing this campaign on facebook or any social-media site of your choice :)

Thanks for stopping by and we look forward to playing for you, whether it be through your stereo speakers or live. If you can't make it to see us play in Reykjavík this fall, in the meantime you can always watch the following video of us playing in prospect park with our friend Toby!


Love,

Feather & Folly

/

Júlía & Holly


Bandcamp: http://featherandfolly.bandcamp.com/

story:
CREATIVE CHANGE CAMPAIGN!!! 


Who Am I You Ask?

I am Canadian singer-songwriter, Scott Barker and I want to help the helpless....but first, I need a little help from you!

  • I have a voice!  I want to use it to give others a voice as well.
  • I am currently working towards my degree in musical theatre at Sheridan College, in Oakville Ontario.

  • I recently travelled to South Africa and Mozambique to volunteer with an organization called Project Purpose which helps bring women and children, who are trapped in human trafficking and prostitution, to freedom. Before I went I raised awareness and funds for these issues through a coffee-house concert. While I was in Africa I shared my music everyday to help bring hope, happiness and healing.
  • I am currently in the works of putting on another concert in the Rainy River District with the help of Victim Services to raise funds and awareness to go towards these issues. Stay tuned for more details on this exciting project.



How You Can Help

This summer I have been given the opportunity to take things to the next level:

  • I have been selected as 1 of 32 young adults from around the globe to participate in The 18 Inch Journey in North Carolina.
  • At the 18 Inch Journey I will be working with professional singer-songwriters such as Jonathan David Helser, Melissa Helser, Molly Skaggs, and others.
  • I am looking to raise $2000 of my $3500 tuition for the 18 Inch Journey. 
  • Help me get to the 18 Inch Journey, a program where I can work with professional singers, songwriters and other professional creative artists of all kinds for 2 FULL MONTHS!
  • This program will help set me up for long term success, spiritually, personally, creatively and professionally in the world of performing arts, which in turn will set me up to better help others.


What YOU Get!

We all like a WIN, WIN situation right?! For every contribution you make you will also get something special. What you get is up to you!

  • For every donation you make there are many different things to choose from, including original song downloads, pictures drawn by me, a cover video dedicated to you,  a new song I write dedicated you, and I will even name my guitar after someone.
  • Check out the column on the right FULL OF PERKS!
  • I figured we might as well have some fun, and this is the best way I can thank you all for your amazing support!
  • Thank you for helping me make creative change.


Help Spread via Social Media

Not everyone has the cash flow, but everyone can still help!

Please spread the word about this campaign by sharing on FACEBOOK, TWITTER, and INSTAGRAM!  #creativechange

Here's where you can follow the campaign.

  • FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/creativechangecampaign
  • INSTAGRAM - http://instagram.com/scottbarker90
  • TWITTER - https://twitter.com/ScottBarker90
  • YOUTUBE - https://www.youtube.com/user/scottbarker90

story:
Blues for Miles Recording Project

Hi, my name is Greg Murphy and I’m a pianist and composer. I’ve led, directed, and performed with various groups throughout the world for the past three decades. One of the highlights of my career was playing and recording with the great drummer, Rashied Ali. I’ve also performed with Carlos Santana, Ornette Coleman, Flava Flav, Alyson Williams, T. S. Monk, Grachan Moncur, III, Ravi Coltrane, Harry Connick, Jr., Raphael Cruz, Iris Chacon, Donald Harrison, Dizzy Reece, Wynton Marsalis, Joe Lovano and Arthur Taylor, as well as countless other great musicians.

I’m recording material for my new album, "Blues for Miles." The CD is going to be released on my label, JazzIntensity Records. Here is a list of musicians currently confirmed to play on Blues for Miles:

Raphael Cruz (Miles Davis, McCoy Tyner, Herbie Hancock, George Benson, Chaka Kahn, Herbie Mann, The Crusaders, etc.) - Percussion

Josh Evans (Cedar Walton, Benny Golson, Ralph Peterson, Winard Harper, Shelia Jordan, Rashied Ali, etc.) - Trumpet

Bruce Cox (Sonny Rollins, Fred Wesley and the New JBs, JJ Johnson, Memphis Slim, Stanley Turrentine, DeeDee Bridgewater, etc.) - Drums

Tom DiCarlo (Stanley Cowell, Norman Simmons, etc.) - Bass

Kush Abadey (Wallace Roney, Frank Lacy, etc.) - Drums

Ben Solomon (Wallace Roney, etc.) - Tenor Sax

Luis Guell (6 Grammy Nominations for Mastering, Mixing, etc.) - Engineer

It’s going to be a great album, but with your help it’s going to be extraordinary. Your contribution is key to achieving my goal - to get the album to number one (#1) on the national jazz charts. This is definitely an achievable goal as I’ve gotten my previous album “Orientation” in the top 50 of the national jazz charts for radio airplay.

I’m trying to raise $15,000. Here’s a breakdown of the budget:

Production costs - $8,500

  • Studio fees - $3,500 for recording, mixing and mastering
  • Musician fees - $5,000

Post Production costs - $2,500

  • Cover art (graphics) and liner notes - $1,000
  • CD manufacturing - $1,500

Distribution and Promotion costs - $4,000

  • Distribution to online stores, websites, magazines and publications - $1,000
  • Radio Promotion - $3,000

When you contribute, some of the perks you’ll receive are:

  • Wristbands, T-Shirts
  • Mp3 downloads, Autographed CDs
  • Autographed Score, Private piano lessons
  • Co-Executive and Executive Producer credit
  • The opportunity to name a composition
  • Free admission and beverages to upcoming concerts
  • Private performance in the NYC metro area and beyond

So far, I’ve recorded some solo piano and trio compositions for this project, and I have more material that I’d like to include. Tom DiCarlo and Chris Beck did a fantastic job on bass and drums and Jay Rodriguez did an awesome job of recording me and the group. All of the music in the promo video was recorded at these sessions.

100% of your contribution will go directly toward the completion of this project. If we don’t reach our funding goals during this campaign we will raise the funds through additional methods.

Your contribution is extremely valuable. You will be contributing to the development and preservation of the Jazz Art-Form, which has strong roots in the African-American community - a community of which I am part. You’ll also be helping the other musicians, artists and technicians involved in this project.

I’ve had some success with my last album. With your help, this album will be exponentially more successful.

There are other ways that you can help besides contributing financially:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

I will certainly keep you updated on the progress of our project throughout the campaign.

Thanks and have a great week!

Greg

BIOGRAPHY

An experienced improviser, composer, arranger and teacher, Greg Murphy has led, directed and performed with various groups throughout the world for the past three decades. Maxwell Chandler of JazzPolice.com writes in a 2009 review of Rashied Ali Quintet’s Live in Europe: “Throughout the album Greg Murphy’s piano possesses a cerebral element which allows for shimmering smoke and discordant percussive runs while never becoming overly fragile or sounding as if merely hitting the keys hard and fast.” In a 2007 review of Greg’s CD, Orientation, Charles Winokoor of Cadence Magazine writes “…throw a tongue-twisting, rapid-fire chart at this son of a gun and watch out-he can burn with the best of them. And did I mention his band is the embodiment of liquid flame? Well they are, and so is Murphy, which is why one should keep posted.”

A jazz study grant from the National Endowment for the Arts in 1984 gave Greg the opportunity to go New Orleans and study with the eminent pianist and jazz educator, Ellis Marsalis.  He remained there and began recording and performing with The New Orleans Jazz Couriers, Percussion Incorporated, and his own group, The Fusicians.  The Percussion Incorporated album, Drum Talk, was recorded and released in 1987. While living in the crescent city, Greg performed with Donald Harrison, Wynton Marsalis, and countless other great musicians.

Greg moved to New York in 1987 and began what had become a long association with multi-directional drummer, Rashied Ali.  Greg performed and recorded with Ali and his various groups throughout Europe, Canada, the United States and beyond, from 1987 until Rashied passed away in 2009.  Below are some additional highlights of Greg’s career:

1989 - Performed in Tokyo, Japan with his trio, and toured the United States with a quartet.

1990 - Ornette Coleman asked Greg to put together a rhythm section to work on Coleman’s new jazz-funk original music, which resulted in a successful debut performance in New York. He later toured France with Rashied Ali in a group featuring Carlos Santana and Archie Shepp and led a septet (Club Bird Jazz All Stars) in Yokohama, Japan.

1991 - Performed solo in St. Johns, Newfoundland, Canada--where he was born. He also studied in New York City with Ron Carter and Jaki Byard at City College and The Manhattan School of Music, as well as privately with Larry Willis and Walter Bishop Jr.

1995 - Meditations with Rashied Ali and Prima Materia was recorded - Knitting Factory Works.

1996 - Bells with Rashied Ali and Prima Materia - recorded on the Knitting Factory Works label.

1999 - A Mano by Raphael Cruz was released on the Worldbeat Records label and Heart Sound with Tisziji Munoz was released on the Anami Records label.

2001 - No One in Particular with Rashied Ali was released on the Survival Records label where Greg wrote the title tune.

2004 - Let’s Get Started, his first recording as a leader, was released on Murphasaurus Records.

2005 - Performed for two months in Shanghai, Peoples Republic of China.

2006 - Graduated from New Jersey City University with a Bachelors of Music Degree in Jazz Performance, studying piano and arranging with Allen Farnham and Pete McGuiness. Orientation was released on the Murphasaurus Records label and Judgment Day Vol. 1 and Judgment Day Vol. 2 by The Rashied Ali Quintet were released on the Survival Records label.

2007 - Greg worked closely with Rashied and his company Survival Records, helping with tour organization, publicity, promotion, distribution, website development and administration.

2008 - Time Travel by Raphael Cruz was released on the RC Records label. Greg launched a new online mp3 store called JazzIntensity.com.

2009 - Live in Europe by the Rashied Ali Quintet was released on the Survival Records label, and the website Rashiedali.org was launched. He led his own groups at Sweet Rhythm, Smalls, Zinc Bar and other venues in NYC.

2010 - Directed and performed with The Ignacio Moran Trio at the Philippine International Jazz Festival, and also performed six nights at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Manila. He led his own groups at The Blue Note, Smalls, and Fat Cat in New York City.

2011 - Led his own groups at the Westfield (NJ) Jazz Festival,) Smalls, Fat Cat, and monthly solo piano performances at Lorenzo’s at the Hilton Garden Inn in Staten Island.

2012 - In addition to performing frequently as a side man for various artists, Greg led his own groups at the Westfield (NJ) Jazz Festival, Casa Dante (Jersey City) Smalls, Fat Cat, as well as monthly solo piano performances at Lorenzo’s.

Greg also performed the theme song “Brother Can You Spare a Dime” for the HBO documentary “Redemption,” which was produced and directed by Jon Alpert and Matthew O’Neill. Redemption received a 2013 Academy Award nomination for best documentary short.

Some of the other people Greg has played with are:  Muhammad Ali, Barry Altshul, Wes Anderson, Mickey Bass, Cindy Blackman, Terrence Blanchard, T. K. Blue, Hammiet Blueitt, Don Braden, George Braithwait, John Brown, Iris Chacon, Alan Chase, Ravi Coltrane, Harry Connick, Jr., Jesse Davis, Steve Davis, Andy Eulau, Flava Flav, Al Foster, Mat Garrison, Charles Gayle, Victor Goines, Ray Gomez, Roy Hargrove, Winard Harper, Vincent Herring, Tim Horner, David Jensen, Victor Jones, Frank Lacey, Joe Lovano, Branford and Delfayo Marsalis, Christian McBride, Charles McPherson, Tyler Mitchell, Grachan Moncur, III, T. S. Monk, Wilbur Morris, Steve Neil, Charles Nevile, William Parker, Don Pate, C. C. Peniston, Dizzy Reece, Arthur Rhames, Larry Ridley, Dale Robbins, Jay Rodriguez, Antoine Roney, Bill Saxton, Ron Sutton, Lew Tabackin, Arthur Taylor, James Blood Ulmer, Reginald Veal, Bill Ware, David  S. Ware, Alyson Williams, Willie Williams, Frank Wright, Al & Ruth Wright, Eric Wyatt, and  Kiani Zawadi.
